Description: Copied in the changes from the Shotwell vapi files and fixed up and tested the associated vala. All of these code changes relate to importing and previewing files from a camera which I've just tested still works with my Pixel 4a. I also changed how the image-missing icon is loaded in the import page as this was not working and causing criticals in the terminal. This should get us some memory leak fixes as we've now got rid of a lot of the manual memory management that wasn't done right anyway.
Description Abstract: Copied in the changes from the Shotwell vapi files and fixed up and tested the associated vala. All of these code changes relate to importing and previewing files from a camera which I've just tested still works with my Pixel 4a. I also changed how the image-missing icon is loaded in the import page as this was not working and causing criticals in the terminal. This should get us some memory leak fixes as we've now got rid of a lot of the manual memory management that wasn't done right anyway.

Description: Relax some restrictions on zooming   Increase max possible zoom  Zoom without Ctrl  Fine zoom with Ctrl   Do not zoom if last zoom incomplete   Aggregate smooth scroll events   Revert unmodified scroll for zoom   Ctrl + Scroll -> Coarse zoom   Ctrl + Alt+ Scroll -> Fine zoom   Consistently use zoom_assembly as name of instance of class SliderAssembly   Add tooltips to slider assembly in CollectionPage   Add all tooltips in SliderAssembly class   Use "zoom level" for both Collection and Single Photo views   Remove unused custom tooltip property from SliderAssembly   Use tooltip text from Code zoom adjustment tool   Use Granite.accel_to_string ("")   Co-authored-by: Cassidy James Blaede cassidy@elementary.io
Description Abstract: Relax some restrictions on zooming Increase max possible zoom Zoom without Ctrl Fine zoom with Ctrl Do not zoom if last zoom incomplete Aggregate smooth scroll events Revert unmodified scroll for zoom Ctrl + Scroll -> Coarse zoom Ctrl + Alt+ Scroll -> Fine zoom Consistently use zoom_assembly as name of instance of class SliderAssembly Add tooltips to slider assembly in CollectionPage Add all tooltips in SliderAssembly class Use "zoom level" for both Collection and Single Photo views Remove unused custom tooltip property from SliderAssembly Use tooltip text from Code zoom adjustment tool Use Granite.accel_to_string ("") Co-authored-by: Cassidy James Blaede cassidy@elementary.io

Message: Handle the SMOOTH_SCROLL events to enable smooth scrolling.
Description: As the per-direction mousewheel events have been propagated to subclasses, and the smooth scroll (since 3.4) can have multiple directions (see [1]), check the delta values and propagate for all directions (at most two, one vertical and one horizontal scroll). [1] https://developer.gnome.org/gdk3/stable/gdk3-Event-Structures.html#GdkScrollDirection
Message Abstract: Handle the SMOOTH_SCROLL events to enable smooth scrolling.
Description Abstract: As the per-direction mousewheel events have been propagated to subclasses, and the smooth scroll (since 3.4) can have multiple directions (see [1]), check the delta values and propagate for all directions (at most two, one vertical and one horizontal scroll). [1] link

Message: Merge po files, set up for intltool and l10n.gnome.org
Description: This removes the custom .pot file setup we had before, making it easy to translate Shotwell using the standard intltool workflow. This also merges the two separate core/extras gettext domains into one, to keep things simple.  I hope I've merged all the po files correctly, but I wouldn't bet money I did it perfectly. We also set up the help to be able to be translated on l10n.gnome.org. Closes: bgo #718783
Message Abstract: Merge po files, set up for intltool and l10n.gnome.org
Description Abstract: This removes the custom .pot file setup we had before, making it easy to translate Shotwell using the standard intltool workflow. This also merges the two separate core/extras gettext domains into one, to keep things simple.  I hope I've merged all the po files correctly, but I wouldn't bet money I did it perfectly. We also set up the help to be able to be translated on l10n.gnome.org. Closes: bgo #718783

Message: Add translator comments for strftime strings: Refs bgno#716533
Description: The strftime strings for local-specific date/time formats are cryptic, so hopefully these comments will help translators make the right choice.
Message Abstract: Add translator comments for strftime strings: Refs bgno#716533
Description Abstract: The strftime strings for local-specific date/time formats are cryptic, so hopefully these comments will help translators make the right choice.

Message: Crash in video interpretable check: Closes #5071
Description: The database and ThumbnailCache calls in check_is_interpretable are not thread-safe although check_is_interpretable was being called from a background thread.  Now check_is_interpretable returns an object with a foreground_finish() function that does the thread- unsafe work there.
Message Abstract: Crash in video interpretable check: Closes #5071
Description Abstract: The database and ThumbnailCache calls in check_is_interpretable are not thread-safe although check_is_interpretable was being called from a background thread.  Now check_is_interpretable returns an object with a foreground_finish() function that does the thread- unsafe work there.

Description: GNOME's pre-commit hooks discovered a couple of gettext problems in three translations.  This removes (by hand) the c-format specifiers that were causing the problem as well as adds the no-c-format comments in the code so the problem doesn't happen again. Finally, msgfmt -c is now used to catch these errors in the future, although the Makefile doesn't abort (like it should) when that happens.  More work necessary for that.
Description Abstract: GNOME's pre-commit hooks discovered a couple of gettext problems in three translations.  This removes (by hand) the c-format specifiers that were causing the problem as well as adds the no-c-format comments in the code so the problem doesn't happen again. Finally, msgfmt -c is now used to catch these errors in the future, although the Makefile doesn't abort (like it should) when that happens.  More work necessary for that.

Message: This should fix the daily build breakage. Let's hold off on closing the corresponding ticket, however, 'til we can confirm that daily builds work again.
Message Abstract: This should fix the daily build breakage. Let's hold off on closing the corresponding ticket, however, 'til we can confirm that daily builds work again.

Message: Make the event context menu and comment-editing dialog inform the user they'll be editing the event's comment. Fixes #6898.
Message Abstract: Make the event context menu and comment-editing dialog inform the user they'll be editing the event's comment. Fixes #6898.

Message: Implements a highlights detail slider in the color adjustment palette to complement the preexisting shadow detail slider. Closes #752.
Message Abstract: Implements a highlights detail slider in the color adjustment palette to complement the preexisting shadow detail slider. Closes #752.

Message: Delivery deftly dodges dreaded delegate duplication discouragement disaster; ref #6893.
Message Abstract: Delivery deftly dodges dreaded delegate duplication discouragement disaster; ref #6893.

Message: Removes useless Glade UI files and lines of support code from the Picasa and YouTube connectors that are no longer necessary now that both connectors use the shared services of the GoogleService family of utility classes in RESTSupport.vala. Closes #6924.
Message Abstract: Removes useless Glade UI files and lines of support code from the Picasa and YouTube connectors that are no longer necessary now that both connectors use the shared services of the GoogleService family of utility classes in RESTSupport.vala. Closes #6924.

Message: Uses more specific language to describe the "strip metadata" option across all four of the core web connectors. Closes #6922 and #6923.
Message Abstract: Uses more specific language to describe the "strip metadata" option across all four of the core web connectors. Closes #6922 and #6923.

Message: Removed stray 'new' keywords when initializing GLib.Mutex and GLib.Cond (both are structs); ref #6893.
Message Abstract: Removed stray 'new' keywords when initializing GLib.Mutex and GLib.Cond (both are structs); ref #6893.

Message: Simplifies the Picasa Connector dramatically by rewriting to make use of the GoogleService support classes developed for the YouTube connector. Enables in-app hosted web authentication in the Picasa Connector. Closes #6907.
Message Abstract: Simplifies the Picasa Connector dramatically by rewriting to make use of the GoogleService support classes developed for the YouTube connector. Enables in-app hosted web authentication in the Picasa Connector. Closes #6907.

Message: Migrate to new officially-blessed cosntructor for ThreadPool; ref #6893.
Message Abstract: Migrate to new officially-blessed cosntructor for ThreadPool; ref #6893.

Message: Adds support for editing the comment of an event from inside the event's page and sidebar context menu. Fixes #6904.
Message Abstract: Adds support for editing the comment of an event from inside the event's page and sidebar context menu. Fixes #6904.

Message: Fixes a problem in which the YouTube Connector would not properly cancel uploads. Closes #6908.
Message Abstract: Fixes a problem in which the YouTube Connector would not properly cancel uploads. Closes #6908.

Message: Factors hosted OAuth support out the YouTube connector and into a series of service-neutral utility classes. Closes #6888
Message Abstract: Factors hosted OAuth support out the YouTube connector and into a series of service-neutral utility classes. Closes #6888

Message: Replaces a deprecated widget in CustomComponents; ref #6893.
Message Abstract: Replaces a deprecated widget in CustomComponents; ref #6893.

Message: Replaces a deprecated constant with an allowed one; fixes #6891.
Message Abstract: Replaces a deprecated constant with an allowed one; fixes #6891.

Message: Corrects a problem where extended info wouldn't display for videos; ref #6887.
Message Abstract: Corrects a problem where extended info wouldn't display for videos; ref #6887.

Message: Tries to migrate the colour-adjust tool window to use a Grid instead of a table; ref #5838.
Message Abstract: Tries to migrate the colour-adjust tool window to use a Grid instead of a table; ref #5838.

Message: Upgrades the YouTube connector to use OAuth 2 authentication, including in-app authentication via a hosted Webkit pane. Closes #3445.
Message Abstract: Upgrades the YouTube connector to use OAuth 2 authentication, including in-app authentication via a hosted Webkit pane. Closes #3445.

Message: Migrate the export dialogue box away from using Table and onto Grid instead. Ref #5838.
Message Abstract: Migrate the export dialogue box away from using Table and onto Grid instead. Ref #5838.

Message: Adds a check to see whether the event is null before trying to extract a comment from it; ref #6878.
Message Abstract: Adds a check to see whether the event is null before trying to extract a comment from it; ref #6878.

Message: Tries to merge smaller events onto larger ones whenever possible, reducing the number of operations that have to be done to complete the merge; part of ref #979 (see comment 24).
Message Abstract: Tries to merge smaller events onto larger ones whenever possible, reducing the number of operations that have to be done to complete the merge; part of ref #979 (see comment 24).

Message: Shotwell now builds again with the --unity-support flag; corrects an issue where the .deps files accompanying the custom Shotwell .vapi files were not included in the distribution tarball. Closes #6859.
Message Abstract: Shotwell now builds again with the --unity-support flag; corrects an issue where the .deps files accompanying the custom Shotwell .vapi files were not included in the distribution tarball. Closes #6859.

Message: Migrates Shotwell's entire codebase, including plugins, to libgee-0.8. Tested with both of the (slightly different) versions of libgee that ship with Quantal and Raring, respectively. Closes #867.
Message Abstract: Migrates Shotwell's entire codebase, including plugins, to libgee-0.8. Tested with both of the (slightly different) versions of libgee that ship with Quantal and Raring, respectively. Closes #867.

Message: Fixes an issue in which the sidebar was not properly styled. Closes #6839.
Message Abstract: Fixes an issue in which the sidebar was not properly styled. Closes #6839.

Message: Works around a problem in glib where two on-disk directories could have different filenames that collated to the same collation key; fixes #6825.
Message Abstract: Works around a problem in glib where two on-disk directories could have different filenames that collated to the same collation key; fixes #6825.

Message: Precaches the exposure time of Photo objects in order to speed up certain operations with them. Partial fix for ref #979.
Message Abstract: Precaches the exposure time of Photo objects in order to speed up certain operations with them. Partial fix for ref #979.

Message: Makes saved searches aware of photo comments. Closes #6541.
Message Abstract: Makes saved searches aware of photo comments. Closes #6541.

Message: Displays the current git SHA in the Shotwell runtime log. Invaluable for debugging with users that have built from git master. Closes #3655.
Message Abstract: Displays the current git SHA in the Shotwell runtime log. Invaluable for debugging with users that have built from git master. Closes #3655.

Message: Adds a configure option that allows building the Shotwell executable with profiling support. Closes #6805.
Message Abstract: Adds a configure option that allows building the Shotwell executable with profiling support. Closes #6805.

Message: Forces '_modified's exported from camera raw images to have correct orientation. Fixes #6536.
Message Abstract: Forces '_modified's exported from camera raw images to have correct orientation. Fixes #6536.

Message: Fixes an issue where duplicating a photo without an associated event would generate a soft assertion. Closes #6810.
Message Abstract: Fixes an issue where duplicating a photo without an associated event would generate a soft assertion. Closes #6810.

Message: Fixes an issue where the key photo for an event could appear blurry in the event overview if the key photo had an extreme aspect ratio. Closes #1202.
Message Abstract: Fixes an issue where the key photo for an event could appear blurry in the event overview if the key photo had an extreme aspect ratio. Closes #1202.

Message: Corrects an incorrect addition to the THANKS file.
Message Abstract: Corrects an incorrect addition to the THANKS file.

Message: Fixes an issue where Shotwell failed to start when installed a certain way on Fedora systems using the new Red Hat Unified Directory Structure. Closes #5181.
Message Abstract: Fixes an issue where Shotwell failed to start when installed a certain way on Fedora systems using the new Red Hat Unified Directory Structure. Closes #5181.

Message: Uses new EXIF metadata fields, including mapping from ratings stars to percents. Closes #5451.
Message Abstract: Uses new EXIF metadata fields, including mapping from ratings stars to percents. Closes #5451.

Message: Changes saved search and search filter logic such that it ignores diacritical marks (this is to say, the character 'é' is equivalent to 'e'). Closes #6670.
Message Abstract: Changes saved search and search filter logic such that it ignores diacritical marks (this is to say, the character 'é' is equivalent to 'e'). Closes #6670.

Message: Fixes a grammatical error in the flagging photos progress dialog box. Closes #6457.
Message Abstract: Fixes a grammatical error in the flagging photos progress dialog box. Closes #6457.

Message: Migrates the slideshow settings dialog away from table and into grid; part of #5838.
Message Abstract: Migrates the slideshow settings dialog away from table and into grid; part of #5838.

Message: Migrates the extended info window away from a table and into a grid as required by #5838.
Message Abstract: Migrates the extended info window away from a table and into a grid as required by #5838.

Message: Corrects a problem where creating a new event from items highlighted in the library page wouldn't cause the app to navigate to the new event.  Fixes #6728.
Message Abstract: Corrects a problem where creating a new event from items highlighted in the library page wouldn't cause the app to navigate to the new event.  Fixes #6728.

Message: Increases performance of the folder tree view. Closes #6715.
Message Abstract: Increases performance of the folder tree view. Closes #6715.

Message: Updates NEWS and debian/changelog files in preparation for Shotwell 0.14.1 release.
Message Abstract: Updates NEWS and debian/changelog files in preparation for Shotwell 0.14.1 release.

Message: Corrects a problem where pressing [Shift] while viewing an image whose original orientation was anything other than top-left would cause the image to 'snap' to top-left inappropriately; fixes #6734.
Message Abstract: Corrects a problem where pressing [Shift] while viewing an image whose original orientation was anything other than top-left would cause the image to 'snap' to top-left inappropriately; fixes #6734.

Message: The new Graph API-based Facebook Connector correctly sets the privacy level on video uploads. Closes #6694.
Message Abstract: The new Graph API-based Facebook Connector correctly sets the privacy level on video uploads. Closes #6694.

Message: Fixes a translation issue in the Greek translation introduced by my most recent round of translation pulls from Transifex. Special thanks to Joe Bylund for spotting this as I clearly overlooked it when integrating the latest round of translations. Closes #6713.
Message Abstract: Fixes a translation issue in the Greek translation introduced by my most recent round of translation pulls from Transifex. Special thanks to Joe Bylund for spotting this as I clearly overlooked it when integrating the latest round of translations. Closes #6713.

Message: Updates translations in anticipation of the Shotwell 0.14.1 release.
Message Abstract: Updates translations in anticipation of the Shotwell 0.14.1 release.

Message: Fixes a missing mnemonic in direct-edit mode; fixes #6696
Message Abstract: Fixes a missing mnemonic in direct-edit mode; fixes #6696

Message: Updates the Facebook Connector to robustly recover from type 7 and type 8 errors. Closes #6586.
Message Abstract: Updates the Facebook Connector to robustly recover from type 7 and type 8 errors. Closes #6586.

Message: Corrects a problem with 013588718406e2749f7f3b6910a1dce3770113f7 where the Makefile would try to validate the .desktop file before checking whether the desktop validator was actually installed.
Message Abstract: Corrects a problem with 013588718406e2749f7f3b6910a1dce3770113f7 where the Makefile would try to validate the .desktop file before checking whether the desktop validator was actually installed.

Message: Prevent the app from jumping from the library page to an event if an image is dragged there; fixes #4014.
Message Abstract: Prevent the app from jumping from the library page to an event if an image is dragged there; fixes #4014.

Message: Corrects an issue where the makefile blithely assumed that all computers would already have desktop-file-utils installed; ref #6691.
Message Abstract: Corrects an issue where the makefile blithely assumed that all computers would already have desktop-file-utils installed; ref #6691.

Message: Fixes a capitalization and punctuation error in the German translation file. Closes #6690.
Message Abstract: Fixes a capitalization and punctuation error in the German translation file. Closes #6690.

Message: Runs 'desktop-file-validate' on the generated .desktop files and dies early during build time if there's a problem; fixes #6570.
Description: (Also corrects a problem with misc/shotwell-viewer.desktop.head)
Message Abstract: Runs 'desktop-file-validate' on the generated .desktop files and dies early during build time if there's a problem; fixes #6570.
Description Abstract: (Also corrects a problem with misc/shotwell-viewer.desktop.head)

Message: Revert "Causes the application to fall back to the current pixbuf size in Extended Properties->Original Dimensions if the image's dimensions couldn't be read from the metadata; ref #6585." (should not have been pushed)
Description: This reverts commit 547e2251fe0cff819b729fb79415f165d8ed9941.
Message Abstract: Revert "Causes the application to fall back to the current pixbuf size in Extended Properties->Original Dimensions if the image's dimensions couldn't be read from the metadata; ref #6585." (should not have been pushed)
Description Abstract: This reverts commit 547e2251fe0cff819b729fb79415f165d8ed9941.

Message: Causes the application to fall back to the current pixbuf size in Extended Properties->Original Dimensions if the image's dimensions couldn't be read from the metadata; ref #6585.
Message Abstract: Causes the application to fall back to the current pixbuf size in Extended Properties->Original Dimensions if the image's dimensions couldn't be read from the metadata; ref #6585.

Message: Preserve the orientation field for .JPGs when exporting them with stripped metadata; ref #6684.
Message Abstract: Preserve the orientation field for .JPGs when exporting them with stripped metadata; ref #6684.

Message: Changes the way displaying the unmodified version of a photo is handled to use the precache and avoid a crash in direct mode; ref #6236.
Message Abstract: Changes the way displaying the unmodified version of a photo is handled to use the precache and avoid a crash in direct mode; ref #6236.

Message: Ensures that the icon associated with the startup progress dialog is the Shotwell application icon; closes #6641.
Message Abstract: Ensures that the icon associated with the startup progress dialog is the Shotwell application icon; closes #6641.

Message: Removes all hard dependencies on X11 libraries, making Shotwell display-server agnostic and able to run under Weston/Weyland. Closes #6606.
Message Abstract: Removes all hard dependencies on X11 libraries, making Shotwell display-server agnostic and able to run under Weston/Weyland. Closes #6606.

Message: Adds corrupt image errors to the family of errors detected by the import logging system. Closes #6445.
Message Abstract: Adds corrupt image errors to the family of errors detected by the import logging system. Closes #6445.

Message: Makes 'configure' smarter about handling the case where no compatible libGPhoto2 installation is found; fixes #6579.
Message Abstract: Makes 'configure' smarter about handling the case where no compatible libGPhoto2 installation is found; fixes #6579.

Message: For raw files, don't use the embedded preview on the photo page if it's less than 1024 px along its major axis; closes #6594.
Message Abstract: For raw files, don't use the embedded preview on the photo page if it's less than 1024 px along its major axis; closes #6594.

Message: Fixes strftime strings that generated bogus dates in the Catalan translation. Closes #3943.
Message Abstract: Fixes strftime strings that generated bogus dates in the Catalan translation. Closes #3943.

Message: Forces the search filter to propagate to checkerboard pages when they're switched to, more closely matching what the user intuitively expects. Fixes #4300.
Message Abstract: Forces the search filter to propagate to checkerboard pages when they're switched to, more closely matching what the user intuitively expects. Fixes #4300.

Message: Updates French translation in preparation for the 0.14.0 release.
Message Abstract: Updates French translation in preparation for the 0.14.0 release.

Message: Modifies the video reader to ignore auxilliary video container files that come as part of AVCHD bundles. Closes #4943.
Message Abstract: Modifies the video reader to ignore auxilliary video container files that come as part of AVCHD bundles. Closes #4943.

Message: Adds missing command line options to the manpage. Closes #3998.
Message Abstract: Adds missing command line options to the manpage. Closes #3998.

Message: Fixes a bug in the Portuguese translation that affected generation of the .desktop file.
Message Abstract: Fixes a bug in the Portuguese translation that affected generation of the .desktop file.

Message: Changes the semantics of "unsetting" a configuration key in the GSettings configuration engine to mean "reset the GSettings key to its default value." In the past, unsetting was a no-op. Closes #6578.
Message Abstract: Changes the semantics of "unsetting" a configuration key in the GSettings configuration engine to mean "reset the GSettings key to its default value." In the past, unsetting was a no-op. Closes #6578.

Message: Changes error handling sequence in response to token refresh failures in Picasa connector to ensure users whose client IDs were changed by the previous commit are properly logged out.
Message Abstract: Changes error handling sequence in response to token refresh failures in Picasa connector to ensure users whose client IDs were changed by the previous commit are properly logged out.

Message: Changes Picasa client ID and client secret in attempt to interoperate better with UOA.
Message Abstract: Changes Picasa client ID and client secret in attempt to interoperate better with UOA.

Message: Fixes a serious issue in which the endpoint test HTTP transaction run against the Facebook login server would fast-fail, preventing new users from logging into Facebook. Closes #6546.
Message Abstract: Fixes a serious issue in which the endpoint test HTTP transaction run against the Facebook login server would fast-fail, preventing new users from logging into Facebook. Closes #6546.

Message: Fixes numerous translation glitches and re-versions translation files to 0.14.0 in anticipation of the upcoming Shotwell 0.14 release. Closes #6431, #6424, and #6127.
Message Abstract: Fixes numerous translation glitches and re-versions translation files to 0.14.0 in anticipation of the upcoming Shotwell 0.14 release. Closes #6431, #6424, and #6127.

Message: Increases the time Shotwell allows the shotwell-video-thumbnailer helper process to run before killing it. Mitigates some GStreamer 1.0 issues. Closes #6519.
Message Abstract: Increases the time Shotwell allows the shotwell-video-thumbnailer helper process to run before killing it. Mitigates some GStreamer 1.0 issues. Closes #6519.

Message: Corrects a problem where the extended properties box could show stale information after a raw was highlighted, then de-selected. Fixes #6500.
Message Abstract: Corrects a problem where the extended properties box could show stale information after a raw was highlighted, then de-selected. Fixes #6500.

Message: The video thumbnailer now seeks to a fixed value of 1 second into the video's duration in all cases. Previously, it seeked to a timecode that was determined dynamically by taking a percentage of the total video length.
Message Abstract: The video thumbnailer now seeks to a fixed value of 1 second into the video's duration in all cases. Previously, it seeked to a timecode that was determined dynamically by taking a percentage of the total video length.

Message: Corrects a problem where .BMPs couldn't be rotated correctly if metadata-writing were turned on; fixes #3845.
Message Abstract: Corrects a problem where .BMPs couldn't be rotated correctly if metadata-writing were turned on; fixes #3845.

Message: Consumes 'F2' keypresses when nothing is selected in an event to prevent the sidebar from acting on them; fixes #4436.
Message Abstract: Consumes 'F2' keypresses when nothing is selected in an event to prevent the sidebar from acting on them; fixes #4436.

Message: Relaxes an assertion that could fail while removing media sources from a view tracker (and logs the condition that causes the assertion); fixes #6481.
Message Abstract: Relaxes an assertion that could fail while removing media sources from a view tracker (and logs the condition that causes the assertion); fixes #6481.

Message: Update debian/changelog for Daily Build PPA
Message Abstract: Update debian/changelog for Daily Build PPA

Message: Replaces an assertion with a short-circuit return and a debug message. Closes #5155.
Message Abstract: Replaces an assertion with a short-circuit return and a debug message. Closes #5155.

Message: Prevents the background-task progress bar from appearing if there are too few tasks pending to justify it; fixes #2512.
Message Abstract: Prevents the background-task progress bar from appearing if there are too few tasks pending to justify it; fixes #2512.

Message: Relaxes an assertion that could occasionally fail in the SourceHoldingTank, as well as adds some logging for the problem to help us address it in the future; ref #3981.
Message Abstract: Relaxes an assertion that could occasionally fail in the SourceHoldingTank, as well as adds some logging for the problem to help us address it in the future; ref #3981.

Message: Updates version number in Makefile and translation files for the Shotwell 0.14.0PR1 pre-release.
Message Abstract: Updates version number in Makefile and translation files for the Shotwell 0.14.0PR1 pre-release.

Message: Works around a problem where a TreeSet could leak references when going out of scope (this led to a leak and crash in Geary); fixes #6478.
Message Abstract: Works around a problem where a TreeSet could leak references when going out of scope (this led to a leak and crash in Geary); fixes #6478.

Message: Allows compilation with both valac 0.18.x and 0.19.x. Closes #6406.
Message Abstract: Allows compilation with both valac 0.18.x and 0.19.x. Closes #6406.

Message: Fixes an issue where charset annotations could migrate their way into the content text of photo comments. Closes #6359.
Message Abstract: Fixes an issue where charset annotations could migrate their way into the content text of photo comments. Closes #6359.

Message: Patch adds a progress bar dialogue if more than 1000 media sources are being flagged or unflagged at once. Fixes #2937.
Message Abstract: Patch adds a progress bar dialogue if more than 1000 media sources are being flagged or unflagged at once. Fixes #2937.

Message: Proposed patch would make it possible to change the raw developer from the context menus; fixes #4058.
Message Abstract: Proposed patch would make it possible to change the raw developer from the context menus; fixes #4058.

Message: Causes the 'undated' entry to remain at the next-to-last part of the list, right before 'no event'. Ref #1632.
Message Abstract: Causes the 'undated' entry to remain at the next-to-last part of the list, right before 'no event'. Ref #1632.

Message: Fixes an issue in which Shotwell was unable to produce thumbnails for -- and thus import -- photos generated by a recent-model Blackberry camera. Closes #6053.
Message Abstract: Fixes an issue in which Shotwell was unable to produce thumbnails for -- and thus import -- photos generated by a recent-model Blackberry camera. Closes #6053.

Message: Makes the search/filter bar's visibility state a persistent property, so Shotwell now remembers whether the search/filter toolbar is visible between runs. Closes #6416.
Message Abstract: Makes the search/filter bar's visibility state a persistent property, so Shotwell now remembers whether the search/filter toolbar is visible between runs. Closes #6416.

Message: Corrects a problem where the 'Shotwell' development could be inappropriately rotated twice for portrait camera-raw images; fixes #4262.
Message Abstract: Corrects a problem where the 'Shotwell' development could be inappropriately rotated twice for portrait camera-raw images; fixes #4262.

Message: Corrects an issue where the master's orientation could be inappropriately written to after an external edit; fixes #6430
Message Abstract: Corrects an issue where the master's orientation could be inappropriately written to after an external edit; fixes #6430

Message: Ensures that rejected photos are not visible at startup. Closes #4300.
Message Abstract: Ensures that rejected photos are not visible at startup. Closes #4300.

Message: Instead of rotating the pixels and dimensions on export, if we're being asked to write a JPEG, we write the pixels normally and let the orientation field do the rotation for us, fixes #1938.
Description: NOTE: this does not fix the case where reverting after an external editor has set the _modified.jpg to top-left; this was broken out into its own bug.
Message Abstract: Instead of rotating the pixels and dimensions on export, if we're being asked to write a JPEG, we write the pixels normally and let the orientation field do the rotation for us, fixes #1938.
Description Abstract: NOTE: this does not fix the case where reverting after an external editor has set the _modified.jpg to top-left; this was broken out into its own bug.

Message: Updates POT files in the wake of the Shotwell 0.14 string freeze to prepare for the upcoming release.
Message Abstract: Updates POT files in the wake of the Shotwell 0.14 string freeze to prepare for the upcoming release.

Message: Allows uploading of event comments to Piwigo. Closes #6381.
Message Abstract: Allows uploading of event comments to Piwigo. Closes #6381.

Message: Adds three additional slideshow transition effects. Closes #6411.
Message Abstract: Adds three additional slideshow transition effects. Closes #6411.

Message: Makes permissions problems leading to write failures show up under manifest.write_failed; closes #5786.
Message Abstract: Makes permissions problems leading to write failures show up under manifest.write_failed; closes #5786.

Message: Proposed patch would add the path to the currently-displayed development for a raw file to the extended information window; closes #6408.
Message Abstract: Proposed patch would add the path to the currently-displayed development for a raw file to the extended information window; closes #6408.

Message: Adds special-case, date and time correction logic that works around a date encoding problem present in some HTC Android phones. Closes #3314.
Message Abstract: Adds special-case, date and time correction logic that works around a date encoding problem present in some HTC Android phones. Closes #3314.

Message: Proposed patch would show the filesize of the master raw, rather than the development, in extended info; closes #6407.
Message Abstract: Proposed patch would show the filesize of the master raw, rather than the development, in extended info; closes #6407.

Message: Prevents multiple spurious copies of the same image from being generated when the developer is changed; closes #5681.
Message Abstract: Prevents multiple spurious copies of the same image from being generated when the developer is changed; closes #5681.

Message: Uses sort-by-title as a fallback when the configuration system (GSettings or GConf) gives an invalid sort criteria value. This is a major improvement over the previous behavior where Shotwell would error out and crash. Closes #6253.
Message Abstract: Uses sort-by-title as a fallback when the configuration system (GSettings or GConf) gives an invalid sort criteria value. This is a major improvement over the previous behavior where Shotwell would error out and crash. Closes #6253.

Message: Adds a random slideshow transition. Closes #6275.
Message Abstract: Adds a random slideshow transition. Closes #6275.

Message: Modified the text on the straighten tool's affirmative button, fixes #4822.
Message Abstract: Modified the text on the straighten tool's affirmative button, fixes #4822.

Message: Proposed patch would put these in the right place the next time the .pot generator is run; closes #5973.
Message Abstract: Proposed patch would put these in the right place the next time the .pot generator is run; closes #5973.

Message: Allows the user to save a detailed log of any import complications (duplicates, file errors, etc.). Closes #2593 and #3126.
Message Abstract: Allows the user to save a detailed log of any import complications (duplicates, file errors, etc.). Closes #2593 and #3126.

Message: Corrected a typo that broke compilation.
Message Abstract: Corrected a typo that broke compilation.

Message: Corrects a problem where the developer in the photo row could be re-set inappropriately after deleting a stale development .jpeg; closes #6390.
Message Abstract: Corrects a problem where the developer in the photo row could be re-set inappropriately after deleting a stale development .jpeg; closes #6390.

Message: Checks whether we're running on an RTL locale or not, and if so, flips the arrow glyph before adding it to the affected string; fixes #5900.
Message Abstract: Checks whether we're running on an RTL locale or not, and if so, flips the arrow glyph before adding it to the affected string; fixes #5900.

Message: Fixes some broken pango markup in ja.po; ref #6385.
Message Abstract: Fixes some broken pango markup in ja.po; ref #6385.

Message: Adds support for uploading photo comments to the Piwigo Connector.
Message Abstract: Adds support for uploading photo comments to the Piwigo Connector.

Message: Displays seconds in photo exposure date/time in the extended information pane. Closes #5709.
Message Abstract: Displays seconds in photo exposure date/time in the extended information pane. Closes #5709.

Message: Fixes a UI nit in which the "Edit Title" and "Edit Tags" dialogs failed to conform to the GNOME HIG. Closes #6262.
Message Abstract: Fixes a UI nit in which the "Edit Title" and "Edit Tags" dialogs failed to conform to the GNOME HIG. Closes #6262.

Message: Fixes a variety of user experience nits related to adding comments to photos and events. Closes #6353.
Message Abstract: Fixes a variety of user experience nits related to adding comments to photos and events. Closes #6353.

Message: Adds four additional core slideshow transitions. Closes #6347.
Message Abstract: Adds four additional core slideshow transitions. Closes #6347.

Message: Shotwell no longer runs the gsettings-data-convert tool on startup. Closes #6369 and #6252.
Message Abstract: Shotwell no longer runs the gsettings-data-convert tool on startup. Closes #6369 and #6252.

Message: Fixes up 'stale' RAW thumbnails that were generated by older, buggier versions of Shotwell when the developer was set to 'camera'; ref #6315.
Message Abstract: Fixes up 'stale' RAW thumbnails that were generated by older, buggier versions of Shotwell when the developer was set to 'camera'; ref #6315.

Message: Fixes a Raring-specific crash in the new, Graph API-based Facebook Connector. Closes #6345.
Message Abstract: Fixes a Raring-specific crash in the new, Graph API-based Facebook Connector. Closes #6345.

Message: Adds the capability to annotate events with comments. Closes #6271.
Message Abstract: Adds the capability to annotate events with comments. Closes #6271.

Message: Adds a breadcrumb comment to a seemingly-unusual snippet of code in EditingTools.vala.
Message Abstract: Adds a breadcrumb comment to a seemingly-unusual snippet of code in EditingTools.vala.

Message Abstract: Fixes #1550 by writing log messages to stderr when not previously done.
Description Abstract: log_file_stream gets only set if a file is used, then all messages will be written in the file. If log_file_stream is null (means problem with opening the file) the messages will be written to stdout and stderr so no need to write them again to stderr.

Message: Fixed #4562 (single shared menu for all Shotwell views) and #4841 (sidebar and menu flash during import).
Description: With this change the LibraryWindow's UI Manager is shared by all pages in the window.  When you switch to any page, it swaps the menus and toolbars it needs into the shared UI manager, and then swaps them back out when you leave the page. Many of the changes here were because pages were assuming that their widgets existed even when pages were not in view.  With these changes, pages can access widgets only when they are active.
Message Abstract: Fixed #4562 (single shared menu for all Shotwell views) and #4841 (sidebar and menu flash during import).
Description Abstract: With this change the LibraryWindow's UI Manager is shared by all pages in the window.  When you switch to any page, it swaps the menus and toolbars it needs into the shared UI manager, and then swaps them back out when you leave the page. Many of the changes here were because pages were assuming that their widgets existed even when pages were not in view.  With these changes, pages can access widgets only when they are active.

Message: Fixed #4684 (some thumbnails grayed out on startup).
Description: The thumbnail fetching code was sometimes deadlocking in code which held a lock while constructing a singleton JfifFileFormatDriver or JfifFileFormatProperties object.  Vala was unfortunately initializing the lock only when the first instance of the class was created, which could be when one or more threads had already acquired and were waiting on the lock.  So these threads never continued execution after the lock was freed.  I solved the problem by eliminating the lock in these and similar classes.  We now call a static init() method earlier instead.
Message Abstract: Fixed #4684 (some thumbnails grayed out on startup).
Description Abstract: The thumbnail fetching code was sometimes deadlocking in code which held a lock while constructing a singleton JfifFileFormatDriver or JfifFileFormatProperties object.  Vala was unfortunately initializing the lock only when the first instance of the class was created, which could be when one or more threads had already acquired and were waiting on the lock.  So these threads never continued execution after the lock was freed.  I solved the problem by eliminating the lock in these and similar classes.  We now call a static init() method earlier instead.

Message: Fixed a bug: rotate_arb() and friends weren't positioning the rotated image quite correctly, which led to pixels being cut off in the crop tool.  Closes #4753.

Message: Simplified bounding box calculation in compute_arb_rotated_size().

Message: The plugin build system now respects the VALAC environment variable if it is set. Closes #4661.

Message: Handles the case in which an F-Spot database can become deformed whereby fields become null that should never be null, since F-Spot's developers never set NOT NULL constraints on these rows in their SQL DDL code. Improves handling of cases where F-Spot backing photos are unavailable. Closes #4487.
Message Abstract: Handles the case in which an F-Spot database can become deformed whereby fields become null that should never be null, since F-Spot's developers never set NOT NULL constraints on these rows in their SQL DDL code. Improves handling of cases where F-Spot backing photos are unavailable. Closes #4487.

Message: The straighten tool now keeps the crop rectangle within the image bounds.  Closes #4750.
Message Abstract: The straighten tool now keeps the crop rectangle within the image bounds.  Closes #4750.

Message: Closes #4613, #4614 and #4615, as well as slightly improving responsiveness of some editing tools; when preparing to work with an image, we now precache a full-sized copy of how it looks prior to modification, operate on a copy of that, and then scale the result, rather than attempting a fetch every time the pipeline is run.
Message Abstract: Closes #4613, #4614 and #4615, as well as slightly improving responsiveness of some editing tools; when preparing to work with an image, we now precache a full-sized copy of how it looks prior to modification, operate on a copy of that, and then scale the result, rather than attempting a fetch every time the pipeline is run.

Message: Removes the 'autocrop-on-straighten' mechanism, since it could interfere with the crop tool.

Message Abstract: Removes the 'autocrop-on-straighten' mechanism, since it could interfere with the crop tool.
Description Abstract: (This functionality will come back in a future patch, but it'll be done as an actual crop  command, which is more like the right way of handling it.)

Message: Uses carefully chosen CSS that styles the search bar correctly on both Fedora Core 15 (with Gtk+ 3.0) and Ubuntu Oneiric (with Gtk+ 3.2). Mostly closes #3873. The outstanding problem involves the "prelight" or "hover" state of the search bar buttons. This state appears unresponsive to styling using either the CSS or legacy APIs. I'll be in communication with some of the Gtk+ devs over the next few days to see how we can force this state to by styled.
Message Abstract: Uses carefully chosen CSS that styles the search bar correctly on both Fedora Core 15 (with Gtk+ 3.0) and Ubuntu Oneiric (with Gtk+ 3.2). Mostly closes #3873. The outstanding problem involves the "prelight" or "hover" state of the search bar buttons. This state appears unresponsive to styling using either the CSS or legacy APIs. I'll be in communication with some of the Gtk+ devs over the next few days to see how we can force this state to by styled.

Message: Crash fixed when undoing tag merge: #4129
Description: When undoing a complex series of tag merges and moves, Shotwell would regularly crash.  The reparent tag command was holding on to Tag objects during its lifetime.  Proxies would be better, but this is problematic because we can't use a proxy as a map key.  This patch uses the tag's path (as a string) instead of a ref to the Tag itself.
Message Abstract: Crash fixed when undoing tag merge: #4129
Description Abstract: When undoing a complex series of tag merges and moves, Shotwell would regularly crash.  The reparent tag command was holding on to Tag objects during its lifetime.  Proxies would be better, but this is problematic because we can't use a proxy as a map key.  This patch uses the tag's path (as a string) instead of a ref to the Tag itself.

Message: Soft assertions during F-Spot import of duplicates: #4126
Description: I believe this could happen any time duplicates were detected during import.  This might solve other bugs where import is not reporting the right results.
Message Abstract: Soft assertions during F-Spot import of duplicates: #4126
Description Abstract: I believe this could happen any time duplicates were detected during import.  This might solve other bugs where import is not reporting the right results.

Description: Photos taken with Samsung NV10 have improper EXIF date/time format.  This patch allows for Shotwell to interpret them.  The reporter also had trouble with video creation time.  This doesn't appear to be an issue with Shotwell, as the dates were corrupted in the file. However, they exposed an overflow bug, which this patch corrects as well.
Description Abstract: Photos taken with Samsung NV10 have improper EXIF date/time format.  This patch allows for Shotwell to interpret them.  The reporter also had trouble with video creation time.  This doesn't appear to be an issue with Shotwell, as the dates were corrupted in the file. However, they exposed an overflow bug, which this patch corrects as well.

Description: A configure option now allows the user to avoid installing the gsettings-data-convert file (shotwell.convert).  This is useful because the file must be installed in /usr/share/GConf/gsettings (and not /usr/local) for the program to locate it, which is a problem for folks who want to install as a user and not root. Also cleaned up the configure script help, which was still reflecting options no longer available.
Description Abstract: A configure option now allows the user to avoid installing the gsettings-data-convert file (shotwell.convert).  This is useful because the file must be installed in /usr/share/GConf/gsettings (and not /usr/local) for the program to locate it, which is a problem for folks who want to install as a user and not root. Also cleaned up the configure script help, which was still reflecting options no longer available.

Message: Undoing parent tag remove now properly undoable: #4047
Description: Problem was that when a photo was detached from a Tag, that might result in numerous detaches from other Tags (namely, children of the parent being removed).  These need to be stored (and proxied) in the TagUntagCommand. Note that I also noticed some proxy problems in DeleteTag, and I've made some changes there as well.

Description Abstract: Problem was that when a photo was detached from a Tag, that might result in numerous detaches from other Tags (namely, children of the parent being removed). Message: Adds protection against GDK errors by forcing the crop region's boundaries to be inside the image's boundaries.
Description: (The crop box has to move when an image is straightened, and, under pathological  circumstances, one or more corners could end up outside the pixbuf; this forces the sub- pixbuf region we get after cropping to be fully within the image.)
Message Abstract: Adds protection against GDK errors by forcing the crop region's boundaries to be inside the image's boundaries.
Description Abstract: (The crop box has to move when an image is straightened, and, under pathological  circumstances, one or more corners could end up outside the pixbuf; this forces the sub- pixbuf region we get after cropping to be fully within the image.)

Message: 3637 fixes assertion in fullscreen mode when pressing enter
Description: This takes care of an assertion in full screen mode.  All you have to do to hit this is go to full screen, hit Enter and then change to another photo (left, right, etc.) Why did this happen?  Well the LibraryPhotoPage interprets "Escape" and "Enter" as going back to the collection.  FullscreenWindow overrides Escape to mean leaving the full screen view; but it didn't handle Enter.  So what you were left with is a full screen view of your photo with no LibraryPhotoPage underneath.
Message Abstract: 3637 fixes assertion in fullscreen mode when pressing enter
Description Abstract: This takes care of an assertion in full screen mode.  All you have to do to hit this is go to full screen, hit Enter and then change to another photo (left, right, etc.) Why did this happen?  Well the LibraryPhotoPage interprets "Escape" and "Enter" as going back to the collection.  FullscreenWindow overrides Escape to mean leaving the full screen view; but it didn't handle Enter.  So what you were left with is a full screen view of your photo with no LibraryPhotoPage underneath.

Description: This fixes a rather subtle crash left over from the sidebar refactoring.  Creating a new event always creates an undated event, then populates the date when the photos are added in a second step. But the code to add undated events accidentally had swapped the comparator (used to sort the undated events) between the parent and child.
Description Abstract: This fixes a rather subtle crash left over from the sidebar refactoring.  Creating a new event always creates an undated event, then populates the date when the photos are added in a second step. But the code to add undated events accidentally had swapped the comparator (used to sort the undated events) between the parent and child.

Message: 3629 send-to with multiple users (and other multi-user /tmp bugs)
Description: Previously we used /tmp/shotwell for exporting temp files before e-mailing or publishing. The problem with this is that if multiple users are signed in to the same machine using Shotwell, only the first user to write to /tmp/shotwell will be successful since they own the write permissions to that folder. Rather than making the folder world-writable, we're now using the folder /tmp/shotwell-{uid} so each user has their own folder.
Message Abstract: 3629 send-to with multiple users (and other multi-user /tmp bugs)
Description Abstract: Previously we used /tmp/shotwell for exporting temp files before e-mailing or publishing. The problem with this is that if multiple users are signed in to the same machine using Shotwell, only the first user to write to /tmp/shotwell will be successful since they own the write permissions to that folder. Rather than making the folder world-writable, we're now using the folder /tmp/shotwell-{uid} so each user has their own folder.

Message: Changed SPIT to pass Spit.EntryPointParams struct rather than plain values to allow for future expansion.  This was precipitated by the publishing plugins needed to know their module file early so they can load their icons.  Also updated the simple-plugin, which suffered from bitrot after some earlier interface changes.
Message Abstract: Changed SPIT to pass Spit.EntryPointParams struct rather than plain values to allow for future expansion.  This was precipitated by the publishing plugins needed to know their module file early so they can load their icons.  Also updated the simple-plugin, which suffered from bitrot after some earlier interface changes.

Message: Some strings marked for translation had been broken apart with the string concatenation ("+") operator. This is not compatible with GNU gettext. This had caused a bad POT file to be generated. These strings were fixed.

Message: This addresses #3245 by adding the option to replace \r and \n characters in prepare_input_text() with the STRIP_CRLF option, making sure that event renaming properly uses this option, and reaps some unused code from PhotoMetadata.vala as well.

Message Abstract: 3241: Search bar is activated (made visible) when the user makes any change to filtering.

Message: 3188: Find button added to toolbars on pages that show media (but not pages that show events).  Some other code cleanup too, including moving to a single Gtk.ActionGroup for common actions, meaning that LibraryWindow doesn't have to synchronize actions when pages are switched from (and that pages can monitor those actions for their own state, which cleans up EventDirectoryPage a bit).
Message Abstract: 3188: Find button added to toolbars on pages that show media (but not pages that show events).  Some other code cleanup too, including moving to a single Gtk.ActionGroup for common actions, meaning that LibraryWindow doesn't have to synchronize actions when pages are switched from (and that pages can monitor those actions for their own state, which cleans up EventDirectoryPage a bit).

Message: This addresses #3212 by not creating or showing the size-chooser widgets if the current media types don't include photographs.
Message Abstract: This addresses #3212 by not creating or showing the size-chooser widgets if the current media types don't include photographs.

Message: This addresses #3232 by saving the user's size choice to, and restoring it from, gconf.
Message Abstract: This addresses #3232 by saving the user's size choice to, and restoring it from, gconf.

Message: This fixes 3230 by restoring the ui object for this dialog box (it had gone missing as of 2640, Glade bug suspected)
Message Abstract: This fixes 3230 by restoring the ui object for this dialog box (it had gone missing as of 2640, Glade bug suspected)

Message: 3185: Selection time on a page would grow each time a page was switched back to.  Fixed.
Message Abstract: 3185: Selection time on a page would grow each time a page was switched back to.  Fixed.

Message: 3250: Progress bar now displayed while printing.  Operation can be cancelled from its Cancel button.
Message Abstract: 3250: Progress bar now displayed while printing.  Operation can be cancelled from its Cancel button.

Message: This addresses #3216 by making SuccessPane's constructor take an argument that tells how many media items have been uploaded, and altering the displayed string based on whether that argument is equal to one or not.
Description: When the pane is created and installed, we pass publishables.length, which should tell us how many media items the user was trying to publish.
Message Abstract: This addresses #3216 by making SuccessPane's constructor take an argument that tells how many media items have been uploaded, and altering the displayed string based on whether that argument is equal to one or not.
Description Abstract: When the pane is created and installed, we pass publishables.length, which should tell us how many media items the user was trying to publish.

Message: Fixes a problem in which publishing to Picasa Web Albums and YouTube would fail if a media item's title contained non-ASCII characters. Closes #3081.
Message Abstract: Fixes a problem in which publishing to Picasa Web Albums and YouTube would fail if a media item's title contained non-ASCII characters. Closes #3081.

Message: Fixes two regressions introduced when the Flickr and Facebook connectors were ported from the legacy publishing API to the new pluggable publishing API. Closes #3171 and #3252.
Message Abstract: Fixes two regressions introduced when the Flickr and Facebook connectors were ported from the legacy publishing API to the new pluggable publishing API. Closes #3171 and #3252.

Message: 3233: Fixes crasher caused by marking a photo Rejected and then back to Unrated while in full-window mode.  This cleans up some of the bookkeeping in ViewCollection with how hidden items are dealt with when they're selected as well.
Message Abstract: 3233: Fixes crasher caused by marking a photo Rejected and then back to Unrated while in full-window mode.  This cleans up some of the bookkeeping in ViewCollection with how hidden items are dealt with when they're selected as well.

Message: This addresses #3016 by checking whether any of the media items in an event have altered exposure times (as opposed to the alteration type "metadata, time" which is valid for whole events, but not individual images or videos).  If one or more media items has an exposure time change, the entire event is marked as 'dirty' so the sidebar will know to re-examine the fields and refresh them.
Description: In addition, if the event doesn't yet have user-assigned name, a "metadata, name" alteration is sent up, since the name displayed for the event will need to change from 'Event XXXX' to the start date of the event.
Message Abstract: This addresses #3016 by checking whether any of the media items in an event have altered exposure times (as opposed to the alteration type "metadata, time" which is valid for whole events, but not individual images or videos).  If one or more media items has an exposure time change, the entire event is marked as 'dirty' so the sidebar will know to re-examine the fields and refresh them.
Description Abstract: In addition, if the event doesn't yet have user-assigned name, a "metadata, name" alteration is sent up, since the name displayed for the event will need to change from 'Event XXXX' to the start date of the event.

Message: 3248: Fixes critical assertion when null string is passed to guarded_markup_escape_text().
Message Abstract: 3248: Fixes critical assertion when null string is passed to guarded_markup_escape_text().

Message Abstract: Ports the Flickr connector to new pluggable publishing API. Closes #3200.

Message: 3044: Now writing metadata to all 3 domains on an update.
Message Abstract: 3044: Now writing metadata to all 3 domains on an update.

Message Abstract: This fixes 3124; we now use the GConf system to remember whether the user had the find bar hidden or shown, and on start up, we set it to this.

Message: 3211: Brought back View -> Filter Photos, which is now available whenever the search bar is available.  #3225: Adjusted the search filter tooltips.  Reworked search filter to split out the Gtk.Actions (which are then shared among all pages).
Message Abstract: 3211: Brought back View -> Filter Photos, which is now available whenever the search bar is available.  #3225: Adjusted the search filter tooltips.  Reworked search filter to split out the Gtk.Actions (which are then shared among all pages).

Message Abstract: This addresses #3124; it's copied and pasted from the original fix (see r2615)

Message: Make the toolbar button background color match the toolbar background.
Description: This partially fixes http://trac.yorba.org/ticket/3215 .
Message Abstract: Make the toolbar button background color match the toolbar background.
Description Abstract: This partially fixes link .

Message: 3188: Added back Ctrl+F to set cursor focus to the text entry box in the search bar.  This patch also allows the search bar to be hidden and available through View -> Search Bar.
Message Abstract: 3188: Added back Ctrl+F to set cursor focus to the text entry box in the search bar.  This patch also allows the search bar to be hidden and available through View -> Search Bar.

Message: This fixes 2916 by doing the following:
Description: 1. Adds an enum with values for the standard (720 px) and large (2048 px) picture sizes.    2. Adds support to the various publishing-related methods (do_upload(), on_publishing_options_pane_publish(), etc) for a third parameter telling us what resolution the user chose.    3. Adds a combobox to the legacy options pane in which the user may choose their desired resolution, along with a label and any ancillary layout stuff.
Message Abstract: This fixes 2916 by doing the following:
Description Abstract: 1. Adds an enum with values for the standard (720 px) and large (2048 px) picture sizes.    2. Adds support to the various publishing-related methods (do_upload(), on_publishing_options_pane_publish(), etc) for a third parameter telling us what resolution the user chose.    3. Adds a combobox to the legacy options pane in which the user may choose their desired resolution, along with a label and any ancillary layout stuff.

Message: 2229: Event name is now a date range for events spanning multiple days.  #2599: If an event is named, the date (or date range) appears in its tooltip along with its name.  Both courtesy Wolfgang Steitz.
Message Abstract: 2229: Event name is now a date range for events spanning multiple days.  #2599: If an event is named, the date (or date range) appears in its tooltip along with its name.  Both courtesy Wolfgang Steitz.

Message Abstract: 3170: Plugins can now be enabled/disabled via the Preferences dialog.

Message Abstract: Fixed #3208 (toolbar items shift when rating filter changes).

Message: 3157: Use more processors (when available) for generating mimics.
Message Abstract: 3157: Use more processors (when available) for generating mimics.

Message: This addresses ticket #3004 by checking to see whether we're getting a close or delete event back from the dialog box.  If so, we treat this as cancel and stay on the current photo,
Description: since the user didn't yet decide whether to keep or revert their edits.
Message Abstract: This addresses ticket #3004 by checking to see whether we're getting a close or delete event back from the dialog box.  If so, we treat this as cancel and stay on the current photo,
Description Abstract: since the user didn't yet decide whether to keep or revert their edits.

Message: Updated copyright to 2011 in PO files. Updated English (UK), Finnish, Hebrew, Hungarian, Korean, Portuguese, Russian, Spanish, Swedish, and Turkish translations.
Message Abstract: Updated copyright to 2011 in PO files. Updated English (UK), Finnish, Hebrew, Hungarian, Korean, Portuguese, Russian, Spanish, Swedish, and Turkish translations.

Message: 182: Further work on plugins.  Added reserved symbols to plugin interfaces to make room for future expansion.
Message Abstract: 182: Further work on plugins.  Added reserved symbols to plugin interfaces to make room for future expansion.

Message: 3143: New data model for direct-edit mode to fix navigation problem.
Message Abstract: 3143: New data model for direct-edit mode to fix navigation problem.

Message Abstract: 2611 prevent sidebar scrolling when deleting tags and events

Message: This addresses ticker #853 - holding down ctrl+shift while clicking to choose items works like it does in Nautilus file manager.
Message Abstract: This addresses ticker #853 - holding down ctrl+shift while clicking to choose items works like it does in Nautilus file manager.

Message: Simplified names in the publishing API; fixed a problem with Facebook logout that should've been in my previous commit but wasn't. ;-)
Message Abstract: Simplified names in the publishing API; fixed a problem with Facebook logout that should've been in my previous commit but wasn't. ;-)

Message: Simplifies and refines the new publishing API; at this point, the API is "stable" but not yet "frozen".
Message Abstract: Simplifies and refines the new publishing API; at this point, the API is "stable" but not yet "frozen".

Message: This fixes #3146 by slightly increasing the size of the 'dirty' region when preparing to erase the clip box from the previous frame.
Message Abstract: This fixes #3146 by slightly increasing the size of the 'dirty' region when preparing to erase the clip box from the previous frame.

Message: Fix for #3144 - this adds the ability to press Ctrl-F in any area of the app that has the search box to send focus to it.
Message Abstract: Fix for #3144 - this adds the ability to press Ctrl-F in any area of the app that has the search box to send focus to it.

Message: Fix for #3023; we now check whether a failed external edit file creation is due to insufficient permissions, and if so, display a friendlier error message.
Message Abstract: Fix for #3023; we now check whether a failed external edit file creation is due to insufficient permissions, and if so, display a friendlier error message.

Message: Removed spitter plugin, as it was only intended to test out early implementations of the plugin loader.  samples/simple-plugin is a better place for what spitter set out to achieve.
Message Abstract: Removed spitter plugin, as it was only intended to test out early implementations of the plugin loader.  samples/simple-plugin is a better place for what spitter set out to achieve.

Message: 3160: Plugin headers and VAPI files are now installable.  Must be enabled with the configure script.  A .pc file is also installed.  #2535: Now that all valac warnings have been eliminated and we require Vala 0.10.0 or above, added --fatal-warnings option to Makefile.  #3167: Fixed "unreachable catch clause" build warning.  Also added sample plugin to source tree.
Message Abstract: 3160: Plugin headers and VAPI files are now installable.  Must be enabled with the configure script.  A .pc file is also installed.  #2535: Now that all valac warnings have been eliminated and we require Vala 0.10.0 or above, added --fatal-warnings option to Makefile.  #3167: Fixed "unreachable catch clause" build warning.  Also added sample plugin to source tree.

Message: 3129 fixed segfault when opening photo with missing backing file
Message Abstract: 3129 fixed segfault when opening photo with missing backing file

Message: 3059 jump to last import page after import
Message Abstract: 3059 jump to last import page after import

Message: Fix for #3124. We now track whether we've gotten an event for the escape key, and if so, we clear the search box, otherwise, we let the event proceed normally.
Message Abstract: Fix for #3124. We now track whether we've gotten an event for the escape key, and if so, we clear the search box, otherwise, we let the event proceed normally.

Message: The Facebook Connector, previously ported to the new publishing API, has now been packaged in a separate .so file as a dynamically loadable plug-in. This is the result of both code and build system changes.
Message Abstract: The Facebook Connector, previously ported to the new publishing API, has now been packaged in a separate .so file as a dynamically loadable plug-in. This is the result of both code and build system changes.

Message: Build system now removes temp file leftover during VAPI creation.
Message Abstract: Build system now removes temp file leftover during VAPI creation.

Message: 3121: Fixed critical warning in progress bar.  Needed to wait for realize signal (which means the GDK window object has been created) before calling methods on the GDK window.
Message Abstract: 3121: Fixed critical warning in progress bar.  Needed to wait for realize signal (which means the GDK window object has been created) before calling methods on the GDK window.

Message: Dialogs: made the Preferences dialog regain focus if the user chooses 'Edit -> Preferences' a second time (trac #3001)
Description: PiwigoConnector: changed the mnemonic for the 'Username' field from 'U' to 'N' (#3002)
Message Abstract: Dialogs: made the Preferences dialog regain focus if the user chooses 'Edit -> Preferences' a second time (trac #3001)
Description Abstract: PiwigoConnector: changed the mnemonic for the 'Username' field from 'U' to 'N' (#3002)

Message: 2450: Toolbar now remains pinned in fullscreen mode.  Courtesy Philip Beam.
Message Abstract: 2450: Toolbar now remains pinned in fullscreen mode.  Courtesy Philip Beam.

Message: Refines the new publishing API so that the plugin host completely encapsulates operations on temporary files. This way, plugin writers don't have to deal with temporaries. Changed the reference Facebook plugin to conform to the changed API.
Message Abstract: Refines the new publishing API so that the plugin host completely encapsulates operations on temporary files. This way, plugin writers don't have to deal with temporaries. Changed the reference Facebook plugin to conform to the changed API.

Message Abstract: 601: Import TIFF files.  This represents basic TIFF support, 8-bit pipeline only, using gdk-pixbuf as the support library.

Message Abstract: 3096: Unitize the alien database/F-Spot import code.  Courtesy Bruno Girin.

Message Abstract: Ports the Facebook connector to the new publishing API. Includes refinements to the publishing API to support the ported Facebook connector as well as the soon-to-be-ported Picasa connector.

Message: 2650: Major reorganization of Shotwell source into units, which puts code of related or similar functionality into logical groupings.  Code is now "unitized" or "ununitized".  Four new units are introduced here (unit, util, db, and threads).  More will follow, so that the reorg is in small stages and not one fell swoop.
Message Abstract: 2650: Major reorganization of Shotwell source into units, which puts code of related or similar functionality into logical groupings.  Code is now "unitized" or "ununitized".  Four new units are introduced here (unit, util, db, and threads).  More will follow, so that the reorg is in small stages and not one fell swoop.

Message: A user sent me a file that Shotwell would not import.  It turns out BatchImport was not handling the error case of a file with unreadable metadata (which can happen with RAW files) properly, treating it as a hard error.  This fixes that problem.
Message Abstract: A user sent me a file that Shotwell would not import.  It turns out BatchImport was not handling the error case of a file with unreadable metadata (which can happen with RAW files) properly, treating it as a hard error.  This fixes that problem.

Message: 2969: Auto-import was not detecting content duplicates and importing them.  BatchImport would then detect the MD5 duplicate and untrash the matching file.  This fixes that.
Message Abstract: 2969: Auto-import was not detecting content duplicates and importing them.  BatchImport would then detect the MD5 duplicate and untrash the matching file.  This fixes that.

Message: Some reworking of MetadataWriter to make it less intrusive in the system and to fix some of its bugs.  There is also auxilliary work here to make some of the commands more responsive.  #2976: No more assertion when undoing a move to trash while MetadataWriter was at work.  #2941 and #2978: MetadataWriter's progress bar is more consistent now.  #2974: Renamed tags are now written out to master files.
Message Abstract: Some reworking of MetadataWriter to make it less intrusive in the system and to fix some of its bugs.  There is also auxilliary work here to make some of the commands more responsive.  #2976: No more assertion when undoing a move to trash while MetadataWriter was at work.  #2941 and #2978: MetadataWriter's progress bar is more consistent now.  #2974: Renamed tags are now written out to master files.

Message: 2625: Fixes the thumbnails jumping around when scrolling.  Was able to repro this and see it had to do when tags and/or titles were displayed.  Also, minor fixes elsewhere in the code I detected over the weekend, including a slight change to BatchImport to improve performance when a lot of duplicates are detected.
Message Abstract: 2625: Fixes the thumbnails jumping around when scrolling.  Was able to repro this and see it had to do when tags and/or titles were displayed.  Also, minor fixes elsewhere in the code I detected over the weekend, including a slight change to BatchImport to improve performance when a lot of duplicates are detected.

Message: 2799: Fixes the ordering of the toplevel items in the sidebar.  Now using an ordinal (an enum) to sort the toplevel items, so adding new ones should not be so troublesome in the future.
Message Abstract: 2799: Fixes the ordering of the toplevel items in the sidebar.  Now using an ordinal (an enum) to sort the toplevel items, so adding new ones should not be so troublesome in the future.

Message: Draws sprocket holes as a differentiating visual indicator on video thumbnails. Closes #2575.
Message Abstract: Draws sprocket holes as a differentiating visual indicator on video thumbnails. Closes #2575.

Message: Video thumbnails are now generated from the frame whose timepoint is 1/3 of the video's duration. This eliminates a problem where many video thumbnails would appear black because of fade-in effects. Closes #2568.
Message Abstract: Video thumbnails are now generated from the frame whose timepoint is 1/3 of the video's duration. This eliminates a problem where many video thumbnails would appear black because of fade-in effects. Closes #2568.

Message: This fixes a thrown exception I saw while importing a particular video.  It appears InputStream.skip() has problems with large values that are within its count type's range.
Message Abstract: This fixes a thrown exception I saw while importing a particular video.  It appears InputStream.skip() has problems with large values that are within its count type's range.

Message: 2566: Re-committed import memory leak fix with the addition that it corrects a tread starvation race condition.  Also during testing I discovered a data structure in LibraryMonitor not being locked although it was used by a thread-safe function.  This patch also corrects that.  In essence, this patch is a replacement for r2371 and r2374 with code fixes.
Message Abstract: 2566: Re-committed import memory leak fix with the addition that it corrects a tread starvation race condition.  Also during testing I discovered a data structure in LibraryMonitor not being locked although it was used by a thread-safe function.  This patch also corrects that.  In essence, this patch is a replacement for r2371 and r2374 with code fixes.

Message Abstract: Recent patch for importing caused bug where events were not properly generated.

Message: Makes certain highly-visible strings media-specific (e.g., they now report "photos" when operating on photos, "videos" when operating on videos, or "photos/videos" when operating on mixed collections). Closes #2692.
Message Abstract: Makes certain highly-visible strings media-specific (e.g., they now report "photos" when operating on photos, "videos" when operating on videos, or "photos/videos" when operating on mixed collections). Closes #2692.

Message: 2566: Reworking of BatchImport to keep the background threads busy but never allow their queues to fill up.  The memory leak was actually all the Pixbufs (thumbnails) that were being held in the queue waiting for processing.
Message Abstract: 2566: Reworking of BatchImport to keep the background threads busy but never allow their queues to fill up.  The memory leak was actually all the Pixbufs (thumbnails) that were being held in the queue waiting for processing.

Message Abstract: 2784: Adjust Date/Time dialog checks and grays out "Modify original file" if autocommit metadata is enabled.  Courtesy wolfer.

Message Abstract: added slash as a shortcut for flagging images #2810

Message Abstract: events and tags menus are now ordered consistently #2631

Message Abstract: larger and more re-sizable title and tag name editor #2727

Message: 2811: Fixed crash due to trying to scale pixbufs to -1.
Message Abstract: 2811: Fixed crash due to trying to scale pixbufs to -1.

Message: 2796: Initial cut of VideoMetadata using libquicktime.  A more thorough and robust video metadata library would certainly improve our support, but this is good for now.
Message Abstract: 2796: Initial cut of VideoMetadata using libquicktime.  A more thorough and robust video metadata library would certainly improve our support, but this is good for now.

Message: 2492: Auto-import and auto-commit metadata only take affect once the Preferences dialog has been closed.  Also, changed two chatty directory monitoring logging messages to only appear when TRACE_MONITORING is enabled, and fixed a bug in FlaggedPage dropping thumbnails when they'd had their metadata committed in the background.
Message Abstract: 2492: Auto-import and auto-commit metadata only take affect once the Preferences dialog has been closed.  Also, changed two chatty directory monitoring logging messages to only appear when TRACE_MONITORING is enabled, and fixed a bug in FlaggedPage dropping thumbnails when they'd had their metadata committed in the background.

Message Abstract: 2788: Store orientation in photo files when metadata auto-commit is enabled.

Message: 2492: When auto-import and auto-commit metadata is selected in Preferences dialog, operations will begin almost immediately.
Message Abstract: 2492: When auto-import and auto-commit metadata is selected in Preferences dialog, operations will begin almost immediately.

Message Abstract: Minor cleanup: Placed all the command-line options into their own namespace.

Message Abstract: 2769: Slideshow delay box is now internationalized, and simplified greatly by using a Gtk.SpinButton.  Courtesy Marcel Stimberg.
