Message Abstract: 2770: YouTube and PicasaWeb connectors remember user name if auth token expires.

Message: 1988: Facebook privacy control added.  #2752: Last bit of Facebook video uploading merged.  Both courtesy Jani Monoses.
Message Abstract: 1988: Facebook privacy control added.  #2752: Last bit of Facebook video uploading merged.  Both courtesy Jani Monoses.

Message: 2752: Facebook video upload support.  This and prior commit (Flickr video support) courtesty Jani Monoses.
Message Abstract: 2752: Facebook video upload support.  This and prior commit (Flickr video support) courtesty Jani Monoses.

Message: 1110: Send pictures via Nautilus Send To integration.  #2248: Added View Event for Photo to the full-window page context menu.  #2735: Better temporary file management.  Now using /tmp and relying on the system to manage the files (i.e. delete them at boot time).  This change affects all users of temp files, the largest of which right now are the WebConnectors and Send To.
Message Abstract: 1110: Send pictures via Nautilus Send To integration.  #2248: Added View Event for Photo to the full-window page context menu.  #2735: Better temporary file management.  Now using /tmp and relying on the system to manage the files (i.e. delete them at boot time).  This change affects all users of temp files, the largest of which right now are the WebConnectors and Send To.

Message: 2765: Selecting both photos and videos will offer only services that support both media types.
Message Abstract: 2765: Selecting both photos and videos will offer only services that support both media types.

Message: 2764: Publish button now works for videos.
Message Abstract: 2764: Publish button now works for videos.

Message: Enables seamless integration of photos and videos in tags and events. Closes #2573.
Message Abstract: Enables seamless integration of photos and videos in tags and events. Closes #2573.

Message: 2030: Progress bar now updated as mimic manager generates mimics.  Also implemented a priority system so the various background tasks can share the progress bar.  (Worth discussing what the priorities should be.)
Message Abstract: 2030: Progress bar now updated as mimic manager generates mimics.  Also implemented a priority system so the various background tasks can share the progress bar.  (Worth discussing what the priorities should be.)

Message: 374: Real-time library monitoring.  Currently only available through command-line options --runtime-monitoring and --runtime-import.  Still testing to be done for scalability issues, but this represents the fundamental architecture.
Message Abstract: 374: Real-time library monitoring.  Currently only available through command-line options --runtime-monitoring and --runtime-import.  Still testing to be done for scalability issues, but this represents the fundamental architecture.

Message: Fixes bug reported by Милош Поповић.  Assertion was incorrect; it's possible for files to be removed from DirectoryMonitor during discovery.  This catches it and marks the photo as offline.
Message Abstract: Fixes bug reported by Милош Поповић.  Assertion was incorrect; it's possible for files to be removed from DirectoryMonitor during discovery.  This catches it and marks the photo as offline.

Message: 2694: Video files located outside of library directory are no longer marked offline without verifying existance.
Message Abstract: 2694: Video files located outside of library directory are no longer marked offline without verifying existance.

Message: 2751: YouTube connector now handles 401 error.  Courtesy Jani Monoses.
Message Abstract: 2751: YouTube connector now handles 401 error.  Courtesy Jani Monoses.

Message Abstract: This adds schema version numbers to the warning dialog when attempting to use Shotwell on a newer database.  This could help with debugging problems.

Message Abstract: This fixes a soft assertion that appears when an issue with the database is detected at startup.

Message Abstract: Cleaned up Thumbnail's implementation to take advantage of MediaSource's genericities.

Message: This takes some ideas added to MediaSource and genericizes them to all DataSources.  This simplifies persisting DataSources outside of the database, such as in the thumbnail cache and backlinks.
Message Abstract: This takes some ideas added to MediaSource and genericizes them to all DataSources.  This simplifies persisting DataSources outside of the database, such as in the thumbnail cache and backlinks.

Message Abstract: Added Transifex token to verify new repository location.

Message: Updated Czech, Korean, Japanese, Norwegian, and Spanish translations.
Message Abstract: Updated Czech, Korean, Japanese, Norwegian, and Spanish translations.

Message: 2666: Mark photo as dirty whenever the appropriate metadata is updated, even if autocommit-metadata is disabled.  This persists the dirty flag at all times, meaning if it is enabled MetadataWriter will commit all changes to the backing files.
Message Abstract: 2666: Mark photo as dirty whenever the appropriate metadata is updated, even if autocommit-metadata is disabled.  This persists the dirty flag at all times, meaning if it is enabled MetadataWriter will commit all changes to the backing files.

Message: ViewCollection now supports multiple source monitors.  This is made necessary for video support.
Message Abstract: ViewCollection now supports multiple source monitors.  This is made necessary for video support.

Message: 2658: Escape closes Extended Information window.  Courtesy mcben.
Message Abstract: 2658: Escape closes Extended Information window.  Courtesy mcben.

Message: 2566: Not technically a memory leak, but pixbufs being stacked up in a queue during a disk import due.  Implemented a hysteresis algorithm on the queue to relieve the backlog if it grows too fast.
Message Abstract: 2566: Not technically a memory leak, but pixbufs being stacked up in a queue during a disk import due.  Implemented a hysteresis algorithm on the queue to relieve the backlog if it grows too fast.

Message: Further refactors and stablizes video and data collection systems. Enables videos to be marked offline and placed in the trash can. Detects the installation of new system CODECs and tries to update video thumbnails accordingly.
Message Abstract: Further refactors and stablizes video and data collection systems. Enables videos to be marked offline and placed in the trash can. Detects the installation of new system CODECs and tries to update video thumbnails accordingly.

Message: 2654: Use Shift+Delete for Remove From Library.  Courtest mcbenn.
Message Abstract: 2654: Use Shift+Delete for Remove From Library.  Courtest mcbenn.

Message Abstract: Closes #2656. Based on a patch submitted by Jani Monosones. Credited Jani in the THANKS file.

Message Abstract: 2643: Fixed issue with photos displaying in a single column.

Message Abstract: 1849: Removed FixedKeyFile.vapi and gdk-none.vapi, both binding patches that were fixed a while back.

Message: Cade changes in preparation for 0.11 (but these do not require 0.11 to compile).  0.11 features better code analysis, which is what it's warning about here.
Message Abstract: Cade changes in preparation for 0.11 (but these do not require 0.11 to compile).  0.11 features better code analysis, which is what it's warning about here.

Message: 2287: No more 64-bit printf modifiers.  Courtesy mcben.
Message Abstract: 2287: No more 64-bit printf modifiers.  Courtesy mcben.

Message: 1560: Switched to using Gtk.Actions entirely in our Page code.  I've also restructured how Actions are registered with the UI Manager to deal better with multi-tiered class heirarchies (with MediaPage, we now have three-deep Page classes with Actions that must be registered).  I've also made it easier to update the Actions when ViewCollection state changes and pushed more common Action code (i.e. Undo/Redo) into LibraryWindow.
Message Abstract: 1560: Switched to using Gtk.Actions entirely in our Page code.  I've also restructured how Actions are registered with the UI Manager to deal better with multi-tiered class heirarchies (with MediaPage, we now have three-deep Page classes with Actions that must be registered).  I've also made it easier to update the Actions when ViewCollection state changes and pushed more common Action code (i.e. Undo/Redo) into LibraryWindow.

Message: Introduces the new MediaPage class that treats photos and videos uniformly. As a consequence, allows editing titles and setting ratings for videos. Closes #2584.
Message Abstract: Introduces the new MediaPage class that treats photos and videos uniformly. As a consequence, allows editing titles and setting ratings for videos. Closes #2584.

Message: 2532: If Shotwell can't create vital data files/directories at startup, instead of logging an error and exiting, it displays a dialog box error and exits.  NOTE: This introduces new translatable strings that are not the .pot file.  Although past string freeze, we feel these are very rare cases and won't be seen by 99.9% of users, but should be visible to that one-tenth of a percent that have done something really odd with their permissions.
Message Abstract: 2532: If Shotwell can't create vital data files/directories at startup, instead of logging an error and exiting, it displays a dialog box error and exits.  NOTE: This introduces new translatable strings that are not the .pot file.  Although past string freeze, we feel these are very rare cases and won't be seen by 99.9% of users, but should be visible to that one-tenth of a percent that have done something really odd with their permissions.

Message: Fixes sidebar color when running under dark themes. Closes #2483.
Message Abstract: Fixes sidebar color when running under dark themes. Closes #2483.

Message: 2488: Shotwell will only ask user to copy or link on file import if any of the files or directories are outside the library.  If they're all in the library, we always link.
Message Abstract: 2488: Shotwell will only ask user to copy or link on file import if any of the files or directories are outside the library.  If they're all in the library, we always link.

Message: 2528: libraw-config tries to find thread-safe version of libraw package file (.pc), which is called libraw_r.pc on Gentoo, before falling back to libraw.pc (which is what I expect other packages to use when this is widespread), then going to the manual step.
Description: This will be a heckuva lot easier when libraw is properly packaged. Patch courtesy Valentin David.
Message Abstract: 2528: libraw-config tries to find thread-safe version of libraw package file (.pc), which is called libraw_r.pc on Gentoo, before falling back to libraw.pc (which is what I expect other packages to use when this is widespread), then going to the manual step.
Description Abstract: This will be a heckuva lot easier when libraw is properly packaged. Patch courtesy Valentin David.

Message: 2524: apport hook now distributed with tar ball.
Message Abstract: 2524: apport hook now distributed with tar ball.

Message: 2515: When the root of the library directory was a symbolic link, DirectoryMonitor would fail to search (not following symbolic links) and so all photos in the library would be marked offline.  Then the offline files were searched to see if they were online individually, which they all were, and so they were marked online.  This solves the problem by following symbolic links only in the directory scan.  More thorough symbolic link support needs to happen.
Message Abstract: 2515: When the root of the library directory was a symbolic link, DirectoryMonitor would fail to search (not following symbolic links) and so all photos in the library would be marked offline.  Then the offline files were searched to see if they were online individually, which they all were, and so they were marked online.  This solves the problem by following symbolic links only in the directory scan.  More thorough symbolic link support needs to happen.

Message: 2510: This limits the number of directories that are traversed at any one time to five.
Message Abstract: 2510: This limits the number of directories that are traversed at any one time to five.

Message: Updated Catalan, Chinese (Taiwan), French, and Italian translations.
Message Abstract: Updated Catalan, Chinese (Taiwan), French, and Italian translations.

Message Abstract: 2504: VALAC makefile variable not used when detecting compiler version number.  Courtesy Elliot S.

Message: 2478: Files now added (auto-imported) when discovered at startup (use --auto-import command-line option until #2492 is implemented).  #2491: Now have an update bar for background operations.  More work may need to be done if this is used by multiple background operations at the same time.  Note that this patch does NOT address symbolic links, which is ticketed at #2307.
Message Abstract: 2478: Files now added (auto-imported) when discovered at startup (use --auto-import command-line option until #2492 is implemented).  #2491: Now have an update bar for background operations.  More work may need to be done if this is used by multiple background operations at the same time.  Note that this patch does NOT address symbolic links, which is ticketed at #2307.

Message: This change addresses a long-standing issue in the DataObject/DataCollection system, being able to be notified of what was altered when an "altered" signal is fired.  The Alteration object gives details.  This change gets rid of "metadata-altered" signal, and could potentially be used to reduce other signals as well.
Message Abstract: This change addresses a long-standing issue in the DataObject/DataCollection system, being able to be notified of what was altered when an "altered" signal is fired.  The Alteration object gives details.  This change gets rid of "metadata-altered" signal, and could potentially be used to reduce other signals as well.

Message: fixes an unticketed scrolling prblem for rename in place.
Message Abstract: fixes an unticketed scrolling prblem for rename in place.

Message: There was one oversight in the Trash code: If a trashed (i.e. unlinked) photo was destroyed (removed from
Description: trash) and it was the last photo in an unlinked ContainerSourceCollection (i.e. a Tag or an Event), the Tag or  Event would not be destroyed.  This was being taken care of at startup when the database is verified, but that's  not the right way to handle this.  This patch adds a signal for unlinked DataSources being destroyed as orphans,  allowing for the ContainerSourceCollections to clean up appropriately.
Message Abstract: There was one oversight in the Trash code: If a trashed (i.e. unlinked) photo was destroyed (removed from
Description Abstract: trash) and it was the last photo in an unlinked ContainerSourceCollection (i.e. a Tag or an Event), the Tag or  Event would not be destroyed.  This was being taken care of at startup when the database is verified, but that's  not the right way to handle this.  This patch adds a signal for unlinked DataSources being destroyed as orphans,  allowing for the ContainerSourceCollections to clean up appropriately.

Description Abstract: (Simple change -- an overlooked call when BatchImport was re-factored earlier this week).  The problem of the  thumbnails not being available when the program is closed is a tougher problem.

Message: 2206: Original committer used state to track when Ctrl was pressed/released in regards to the mousewheel zoom
Description: functionality.  Mousewheel events can fall through to the window even when it does not have focus.  If a  mousewheel event comes through when Shotwell loses focus with the Ctrl key down (Shift+Ctrl+M), and then the  ctrl key is released, the state will not be reset until Shotwell regains focus.  Now using the modifier flags  provided by the GDK event.
Message Abstract: 2206: Original committer used state to track when Ctrl was pressed/released in regards to the mousewheel zoom
Description Abstract: functionality.  Mousewheel events can fall through to the window even when it does not have focus.  If a  mousewheel event comes through when Shotwell loses focus with the Ctrl key down (Shift+Ctrl+M), and then the  ctrl key is released, the state will not be reset until Shotwell regains focus.  Now using the modifier flags  provided by the GDK event.

Message: 2111: Refactoring of BatchImport to reduce the overhead of managing background jobs and their completion
Description: callbacks, to keep the UI responsive during an import while (attempting) to not sacrifice speed.  There remains  a corner case when a large number of small files (8,000 8K JPEGs in my test case) will still swamp the UI, but  we will live with that for now ... importing that many in a responsive way will require more work, and more  consideration of BatchImport's requirements.
Message Abstract: 2111: Refactoring of BatchImport to reduce the overhead of managing background jobs and their completion
Description Abstract: callbacks, to keep the UI responsive during an import while (attempting) to not sacrifice speed.  There remains  a corner case when a large number of small files (8,000 8K JPEGs in my test case) will still swamp the UI, but  we will live with that for now ... importing that many in a responsive way will require more work, and more  consideration of BatchImport's requirements.

Message: One slight change to the externally editable commit: orientation (which is a transformation) should only be held
Description: in PhotoTable.  BackingPhotoTable should only hold the source file's original_orientation.  This keeps all  transformations in PhotoTable, freeing BackingPhotoTable to merely store what the backing photo's pristine  state.
Message Abstract: One slight change to the externally editable commit: orientation (which is a transformation) should only be held
Description Abstract: in PhotoTable.  BackingPhotoTable should only hold the source file's original_orientation.  This keeps all  transformations in PhotoTable, freeing BackingPhotoTable to merely store what the backing photo's pristine  state.

Message: 1684: This is a first commit toward support for importing RAW files from cameras.  The current test case (Canon
Description: S90) has this problem: gPhoto will return the thumbnail for the RAW image, but no EXIF.  When the CR2 file is  copied to the local machine, it's possible to extract the EXIF from the embedded JPEG file, but not the EXIF  thumbnail.  This mismatch kills dupe detection.
Message Abstract: 1684: This is a first commit toward support for importing RAW files from cameras.  The current test case (Canon
Description Abstract: S90) has this problem: gPhoto will return the thumbnail for the RAW image, but no EXIF.  When the CR2 file is  copied to the local machine, it's possible to extract the EXIF from the embedded JPEG file, but not the EXIF  thumbnail.  This mismatch kills dupe detection.

Message: This fixes a dimensions problem with certain RAW files (those from Fuji cameras, as it turns out) and improves
Description: exception reporting in GRaw.
Message Abstract: This fixes a dimensions problem with certain RAW files (those from Fuji cameras, as it turns out) and improves
Description Abstract: exception reporting in GRaw.

Message: 522: Initial commit for 8-bit RAW support.  This commit provides support for file import (but not from camera),
Description: JPEG mimicking (to prevent full-sized RAW decodes and processing whenever possible), and a file format  abstraction layer in anticipation of PNG and TIFF support. Some RAW files do not display correctly; some have odd dimensions, other have color problems.  I'm investigating  these currently.  Also, to improve import time, instead of displaying a full-window pixbuf of each photo as it's  loaded, the largest thumbnail is displayed instead.  This behavior can be reinstated, if deemed important.
Message Abstract: 522: Initial commit for 8-bit RAW support.  This commit provides support for file import (but not from camera),
Description Abstract: JPEG mimicking (to prevent full-sized RAW decodes and processing whenever possible), and a file format  abstraction layer in anticipation of PNG and TIFF support. Some RAW files do not display correctly; some have odd dimensions, other have color problems.  I'm investigating  these currently.  Also, to improve import time, instead of displaying a full-window pixbuf of each photo as it's  loaded, the largest thumbnail is displayed instead.  This behavior can be reinstated, if deemed important.

Message Abstract: This simplifies the CheckerboardLayout code, which relied on a more complicated scheme to reflow the layout and
Description Abstract: report exposed/unexposed to the CheckerboardItems.  This change centralizes the state changes and handles them  in the expose-event in a more intelligent manner.

Message: 1538/#1018/#1534: Various flicker problems in CheckerboardLayout fixed by more aggressive batching of updates
Description: into single queue_redraw_for_area() commands, as well as scheduling the reflow higher in the event queue to  reduce the number of exposure events.
Message Abstract: 1538/#1018/#1534: Various flicker problems in CheckerboardLayout fixed by more aggressive batching of updates
Description Abstract: into single queue_redraw_for_area() commands, as well as scheduling the reflow higher in the event queue to  reduce the number of exposure events.

Message: 1539: The reason the photos triggered a false positive in the dupe detection code is that they have no
Description: thumbnail but the exact same EXIF.  Now dupe detection requires that both EXIF and the thumbnail are present,  otherwise a full content comparision will be performed.
Message Abstract: 1539: The reason the photos triggered a false positive in the dupe detection code is that they have no
Description Abstract: thumbnail but the exact same EXIF.  Now dupe detection requires that both EXIF and the thumbnail are present,  otherwise a full content comparision will be performed.

Message: 1519: segault on import solved.  Problem relates to #1520 (also closed in this commit).  Completion callback
Description: was being re-entered due to the thumbnail import code calling spin_event_loop() (which is a legacy aspect of the  old-style import, which was serialized in the main event thread).  Additionally, the BatchImport object was  being derefed and freed because the Workers/BackgroundJob system does not maintain a reference to the object  with the callbacks; this has been remedied.
Message Abstract: 1519: segault on import solved.  Problem relates to #1520 (also closed in this commit).  Completion callback
Description Abstract: was being re-entered due to the thumbnail import code calling spin_event_loop() (which is a legacy aspect of the  old-style import, which was serialized in the main event thread).  Additionally, the BatchImport object was  being derefed and freed because the Workers/BackgroundJob system does not maintain a reference to the object  with the callbacks; this has been remedied.

Message: 1417: Fixes problem of dragging hundreds of photos by using XDS instead of standard GTK drag-and-drop when
Description: dealing with Nautilus.  Because of this change, photo export is remarkably simpler.  Also, refactored the DnD  export code out to a separate class, and the batch export code to a separate function.  Also, a case where  dropping 5000 photos onto a tag being excessively slow is fixed.
Message Abstract: 1417: Fixes problem of dragging hundreds of photos by using XDS instead of standard GTK drag-and-drop when
Description Abstract: dealing with Nautilus.  Because of this change, photo export is remarkably simpler.  Also, refactored the DnD  export code out to a separate class, and the batch export code to a separate function.  Also, a case where  dropping 5000 photos onto a tag being excessively slow is fixed.

Message: Changed three characters in one string in the Welcome dialog: replaced three raw bullet characters ("•") with their corresponding HTML character entity codes ("•" -- correctly interpreted by Pango). This was necessary because the bullet character is a Unicode character outside of the basic ASCII plane, and the GNU gettext tools don't support strings containing characters outside of the basic ASCII plane as inputs for translation.
Message Abstract: Changed three characters in one string in the Welcome dialog: replaced three raw bullet characters ("•") with their corresponding HTML character entity codes ("•" -- correctly interpreted by Pango). This was necessary because the bullet character is a Unicode character outside of the basic ASCII plane, and the GNU gettext tools don't support strings containing characters outside of the basic ASCII plane as inputs for translation.

Message: Replaced one character in one string: in the Welcome dialog, I replaced a typographic right arrow ("▸") with a right angle bracket (">"). This was necessary because the typographic right arrow is a Unicode character outside of the basic ASCII plane and xgettext doesn't support translation input strings that contain characters outside of the basic ASCII plane.
Message Abstract: Replaced one character in one string: in the Welcome dialog, I replaced a typographic right arrow ("▸") with a right angle bracket (">"). This was necessary because the typographic right arrow is a Unicode character outside of the basic ASCII plane and xgettext doesn't support translation input strings that contain characters outside of the basic ASCII plane.

Message: 1355: This commit looks scarier than it really is for this ticket.  Displays each photo's tags beneath the
Description: title, and can be toggled on and off.  Changed the name of the checkerboard item object (been meaning to do that  for some time), which is a lot of the diffs.  Also added a mechanism for setting properties on an entire  ViewCollection, which is a more centralized system than the way we were toggling title and thumbnail size  before.
Message Abstract: 1355: This commit looks scarier than it really is for this ticket.  Displays each photo's tags beneath the
Description Abstract: title, and can be toggled on and off.  Changed the name of the checkerboard item object (been meaning to do that  for some time), which is a lot of the diffs.  Also added a mechanism for setting properties on an entire  ViewCollection, which is a more centralized system than the way we were toggling title and thumbnail size  before.

Message: 1203: Photo caused crash on import due to rounding.  The photo is so wide and short its height was being scaled
Description: to zero.  Now, all scaled dimensions are returned floored at least to one in both dimensions.  This patch also  fixes a problem with the crop/redeye tools on small/narrow/short photos (due to their displayed, scaled  size).

Description Abstract: to zero.  Now, all scaled dimensions are returned floored at least to one in both dimensions.  This patch also  fixes a problem with the crop/redeye tools on small/narrow/short photos (due to their displayed, scaled  size).

Message Abstract: 1183: Now display ISO, exposure, and/or aperture when available, even if not all are available.

Message: 1176: More event generation issues, this time when photos all are in the morning before the event boundary
Description: (4AM).  #1174/#1181: We're now more aggressive searching the JPEG file for EXIF.  This solves the problem of  some photos (either from GIMP or from certain cameras) not being recognized as having EXIF in them.
Message Abstract: 1176: More event generation issues, this time when photos all are in the morning before the event boundary
Description Abstract: (4AM).  #1174/#1181: We're now more aggressive searching the JPEG file for EXIF.  This solves the problem of  some photos (either from GIMP or from certain cameras) not being recognized as having EXIF in them.

Message: removes publishing menu item on windows build.
Message Abstract: removes publishing menu item on windows build.

Message: 1165: Shotwell no longer aborts when import runs out of disk space.  The import will halt and the user will be
Description: presented an error dialog.  Also, fixed Events so small thumbnails are enlarged to fit the square, guaranteeing  all are the same size in the checkerboard display.
Message Abstract: 1165: Shotwell no longer aborts when import runs out of disk space.  The import will halt and the user will be
Description Abstract: presented an error dialog.  Also, fixed Events so small thumbnails are enlarged to fit the square, guaranteeing  all are the same size in the checkerboard display.

Message: reduces number of significant digits displayed for exposure.
Message Abstract: reduces number of significant digits displayed for exposure.

Message: 1163: Import of 160x3 image no longer causes assertion.  #1168: Shotwell would attempt to import files without
Description: supported filename extensions if it was a directory import opertion.  This is now circumvented.  Also,  fixed a rounding error in the EventDirectoryItem code related to rounding-corners that caused some key  photos to not be displayed.
Message Abstract: 1163: Import of 160x3 image no longer causes assertion.  #1168: Shotwell would attempt to import files without
Description Abstract: supported filename extensions if it was a directory import opertion.  This is now circumvented.  Also,  fixed a rounding error in the EventDirectoryItem code related to rounding-corners that caused some key  photos to not be displayed.

Message: Fixed a multi-byte code point issue with the new Pango markup used in the events directory page; merged translation files against current POT file; verified that all translations function as expecte with the 0.4 source tree.
Message Abstract: Fixed a multi-byte code point issue with the new Pango markup used in the events directory page; merged translation files against current POT file; verified that all translations function as expecte with the 0.4 source tree.

Message: removes minimize and maximize decorations on extended info window, fixing #1154
Message Abstract: removes minimize and maximize decorations on extended info window, fixing #1154

Message: 1155: Ctrl++ and Ctrl+- now accelerator keys for zooming.  Code also checks for unadorned plus and minus, or
Description: those keys with any modifier key, in fact.
Message Abstract: 1155: Ctrl++ and Ctrl+- now accelerator keys for zooming.  Code also checks for unadorned plus and minus, or
Description Abstract: those keys with any modifier key, in fact.

Message: 1153: Events now displayed as a squared key photo with rounded corners, with its name centered and in boldface,
Description: with the number of photos in the event below that in smaller font.
Message Abstract: 1153: Events now displayed as a squared key photo with rounded corners, with its name centered and in boldface,
Description Abstract: with the number of photos in the event below that in smaller font.

Message: Added the new pin toolbar icon.
Message Abstract: Added the new pin toolbar icon.

Message: Fixed capitalization in the Extended Information window.
Message Abstract: Fixed capitalization in the Extended Information window.

Message: Fixes a problem with generating too many events when photos are on the same day.
Message Abstract: Fixes a problem with generating too many events when photos are on the same day.

Message: 1145/#1146: These were caused by the programmatic switching of pages.  Some of the other controls (in this
Description: case, the Gtk.TreeView) allow for events to be processed in their own handlers, and causing an expose_event to  be called before Page.switched_to() was invoked.  This is safe, but an assertion was in place to check for pages  being seen when they weren't supposed to.  Since this can happen during a switch, removing this assertion.
Message Abstract: 1145/#1146: These were caused by the programmatic switching of pages.  Some of the other controls (in this
Description Abstract: case, the Gtk.TreeView) allow for events to be processed in their own handlers, and causing an expose_event to  be called before Page.switched_to() was invoked.  This is safe, but an assertion was in place to check for pages  being seen when they weren't supposed to.  Since this can happen during a switch, removing this assertion.

Message: 973: Display corruption when dragging below the last photo in GTK+ 2.18.  There appears to be a change in how
Description: Gtk.Adjustment values are clamped between 2.16 and 2.18.  This patch enforces the limit.
Message Abstract: 973: Display corruption when dragging below the last photo in GTK+ 2.18.  There appears to be a change in how
Description Abstract: Gtk.Adjustment values are clamped between 2.16 and 2.18.  This patch enforces the limit.

Message: 1130: Now detecting bogus EXIF timestamps and treating them as through they're unset.  Will need more work if
Description: want to ignore them in some cases and use them in others.
Message Abstract: 1130: Now detecting bogus EXIF timestamps and treating them as through they're unset.  Will need more work if
Description Abstract: want to ignore them in some cases and use them in others.

Message: Closes #1047 (Facebook publishing should fail gracefully if user has deauthorized application); user is now gracefully logged out when a 102 (session key has become invalid) error is detected.
Message Abstract: Closes #1047 (Facebook publishing should fail gracefully if user has deauthorized application); user is now gracefully logged out when a 102 (session key has become invalid) error is detected.

Message: Closes #1089 (favorites star icon needs touching up).
Message Abstract: Closes #1089 (favorites star icon needs touching up).

Message Abstract: 1122: Photos now imported into proper events, respecting the new event boundary algorithm.  #1134: Help ->
Description Abstract: Contents now goes to new Wiki page.

Message Abstract: Branching in preparation for the 0.4 release.

Message Abstract: Resolves #1136 ("can't publish to Facebook" -- occurred with newly created Facebook accounts where no photo albums were present); makes Publishing dialog taller to accomodate changed Facebook pane layout.

Message: 1137: Needed to monitor the destruction of the duplicated photo and reset the command manager if it occurs.
Message Abstract: 1137: Needed to monitor the destruction of the duplicated photo and reset the command manager if it occurs.

Message: Refinement to the web publishing error reporting.
Message Abstract: Refinement to the web publishing error reporting.

Message: 1124: More fine-grained error reporting in Web publishing.  PublishingError used more thoughly throughout to
Description: facilitate error reporting.
Message Abstract: 1124: More fine-grained error reporting in Web publishing.  PublishingError used more thoughly throughout to
Description Abstract: facilitate error reporting.

Message: Adds new POT file with proper plural forms to the po/ directory; closes #1079.
Message Abstract: Adds new POT file with proper plural forms to the po/ directory; closes #1079.

Message: First commit toward #1124: Finer-grained exceptions in the publishing code.  Added preliminary strings for error

Description Abstract: messages for string freeze.

Message Abstract: Resolves bug #1126 ("publishing dialog buttons should have access keys")

Message Abstract: fixes #1121 (extended info window should be wider) and implements #1019 (publish item in dropdown).

Message Abstract: Changed all gettext invocations in strings with embedded numbers to ngettext calls to support proper plural form handling for non-Western languages.

Message Abstract: adds persistence of sort settings for events, photos within events, and library photos.  #1104 and #1103.

Message Abstract: Introduces a unified publishing subsystem, closes bug #181 ("Export photos to Flickr").

Message: 874: Gap threshold increased to one event per day, with the boundary being 4AM.
Message Abstract: 874: Gap threshold increased to one event per day, with the boundary being 4AM.

Message Abstract: Updated minimal version number for WebKit.

Message: 1102: Bug due to rounding down to zero in integer division.
Message Abstract: 1102: Bug due to rounding down to zero in integer division.

Message: 873: Import and directory reads were slowing down moving between photos in direct-edit mode.  Import is much
Description: faster now (and faster for library mode as well!) and the directory is only read once.  Will need to later  monitor the directory for file additions/removals.  #1106: Modified asterisk now working.  Also fixed other  little bit rots in direct-edit mode that had gone undetected.
Message Abstract: 873: Import and directory reads were slowing down moving between photos in direct-edit mode.  Import is much
Description Abstract: faster now (and faster for library mode as well!) and the directory is only read once.  Will need to later  monitor the directory for file additions/removals.  #1106: Modified asterisk now working.  Also fixed other  little bit rots in direct-edit mode that had gone undetected.

Message Abstract: Added get_int() and set_int() to the Windows GConf implementation.

Message Abstract: takes care of ticket 1096--both of the cases where hiding photos should make the toolbar buttons unavailable.

Message Abstract: fixes 935, making select_all work for event directory pages.

Message: 1069: Pages are now destroyed when removed from LibraryWindow, and each Page destroys all the widgets it
Description: creates that are not contained/parented when the Page is destroyed (i.e. the menu bar).  This issue was  exacerbated by drag-and-drop, which obtains references on all widgets in the application and releases them after  the Page was deref'ed.
Message Abstract: 1069: Pages are now destroyed when removed from LibraryWindow, and each Page destroys all the widgets it
Description Abstract: creates that are not contained/parented when the Page is destroyed (i.e. the menu bar).  This issue was  exacerbated by drag-and-drop, which obtains references on all widgets in the application and releases them after  the Page was deref'ed.

Message Abstract: 1066: Fixed assertion triggered when using Ctrl+H to hide an item while the mouse was hovering over it.

Description Abstract: ViewCollection filtering.  This fixes that so the assertions are properly checked.

Message Abstract: 1058/#1059: Both were related to how hidden photos are handled inside the ViewCollection.  Now reinforcing
Description Abstract: interface where a ViewFilter must be used to control hidden-ness.  Also, found a minor bug where the "View ->  Hidden Photos" was not keeping its state when switching between pages.

Message Abstract: Fixes bug #1030, "Facebook login yields segmentation fault."

Message Abstract: 65/#1001: Undo/redo implemented for all appropriate commands.  When undo/redo selected, switches back to page

Message Abstract: Fixed bug 1020 (imported photos have date January 1900).

Message: 1002: Loosened up the assertion that checks the pixbuf's dimensions in the pipeline.  Pixel-accuracy is too
Description: much to ask here when considering all the subsystems involved.  Now the assertions just check that the pixbuf's  dimensions are in the ballpark.
Message Abstract: 1002: Loosened up the assertion that checks the pixbuf's dimensions in the pipeline.  Pixel-accuracy is too
Description Abstract: much to ask here when considering all the subsystems involved.  Now the assertions just check that the pixbuf's  dimensions are in the ballpark.

Description: Factored out directory-related methods from AppWindow into a new class AppDirs.   On Windows, prepend the directory containing the Shotwell executable to the PATH on startup.  This is necessary so that gconfd can find its DLLs, which live in the Shotwell executable directory.
Message Abstract: Factored out directory-related methods from AppWindow into a new class
Description Abstract: AppDirs. On Windows, prepend the directory containing the Shotwell executable to the PATH on startup.  This is necessary so that gconfd can find its DLLs, which live in the Shotwell executable directory.

Message: This fixes a bug Allison discovered in trunk.  Migrating it to 0.3.0.
Message Abstract: This fixes a bug Allison discovered in trunk.  Migrating it to 0.3.0.

Message: 956: Need to re-hide progress bar after pages are added to the notebook, as this requires a show_all() on it,
Description: which shows all hidden widgets.  This fixes the problem by hiding the progress_bar when necessary when the page  is switched to.
Message Abstract: 956: Need to re-hide progress bar after pages are added to the notebook, as this requires a show_all() on it,
Description Abstract: which shows all hidden widgets.  This fixes the problem by hiding the progress_bar when necessary when the page  is switched to.

Message: 962: The full-window page was holding a ref to the Photo object after it had been deleted, triggering the
Description: assertion.  This change ensures the ref is dropped when a photo is deleted.
Message Abstract: 962: The full-window page was holding a ref to the Photo object after it had been deleted, triggering the
Description Abstract: assertion.  This change ensures the ref is dropped when a photo is deleted.

Message: 957: A function used within the Photo pipeline needed to be performed atomically and was not.  This fixes that
Description: problem and cleans up atomicity elsewhere in the pipeline.
Message Abstract: 957: A function used within the Photo pipeline needed to be performed atomically and was not.  This fixes that
Description Abstract: problem and cleans up atomicity elsewhere in the pipeline.

Message: Added an Inno Setup script which can generate a Windows installer.
Message Abstract: Added an Inno Setup script which can generate a Windows installer.

Message: 961: Fixed.  A long-running problem was that SinglePhotoPage resized the DrawingArea widget to match the
Description: viewport.  This was unnecessary (GtkViewport does this automatically) and, with certain scrollbar policies,  would cause the described problem.
Message Abstract: 961: Fixed.  A long-running problem was that SinglePhotoPage resized the DrawingArea widget to match the
Description Abstract: viewport.  This was unnecessary (GtkViewport does this automatically) and, with certain scrollbar policies,  would cause the described problem.

Message: Changed the event signalling mode of the adjustment palette sliders from Discontinuous to Delayed.
Message Abstract: Changed the event signalling mode of the adjustment palette sliders from Discontinuous to Delayed.

Message: 995: Ellipses fixed when unmounting camera.  #958: Double-clicking slider and moving it is a feature of GTK.

Message Abstract: 995: Ellipses fixed when unmounting camera.  #958: Double-clicking slider and moving it is a feature of GTK.
Description Abstract: Changed code to fix crash due to reference counting/signal disconnect issues.

Message: 656: Remove dialog reworded.  Fixed an HIG issue with the dialog title.
Message Abstract: 656: Remove dialog reworded.  Fixed an HIG issue with the dialog title.

Message: 948: Folders no longer counted as part of the import manifest.  If absolutely nothing is imported, an
Description: appropriate dialog is presented to the user.
Message Abstract: 948: Folders no longer counted as part of the import manifest.  If absolutely nothing is imported, an
Description Abstract: appropriate dialog is presented to the user.

Message: Added code so that we can find the directory where Shotwell is installed on either Linux or Windows.
Message Abstract: Added code so that we can find the directory where Shotwell is installed on either Linux or Windows.

Message: Fixed a bug where a month event page was triggering an assertion when accessed immediately after it was created
Description: by an import.  This was due to Gtk.Notebook.show_all() not being called after the page was added to the notebook  (which is a no-no).  This fixes it, and hopefully ensures it's always called when a page is added.
Message Abstract: Fixed a bug where a month event page was triggering an assertion when accessed immediately after it was created
Description Abstract: by an import.  This was due to Gtk.Notebook.show_all() not being called after the page was added to the notebook  (which is a no-no).  This fixes it, and hopefully ensures it's always called when a page is added.

Message: Use /bin/bash to execute configure.  This avoids a shell portability problem since
Description: different versions of /bin/sh may echo newlines differently.
Message Abstract: Use /bin/bash to execute configure.  This avoids a shell portability problem since
Description Abstract: different versions of /bin/sh may echo newlines differently.

Message: 728: Drag selection now works properly at the bottom of a large collection.  Related to a signed 16-bit
Description: overflow bug when GDK window grab is enabled (reported at https://bugzilla.gnome.org/show_bug.cgi?id=599937). Also, we discovered that signals must be disconnected manually, so have done that as well in places where  required.
Message Abstract: 728: Drag selection now works properly at the bottom of a large collection.  Related to a signed 16-bit
Description Abstract: overflow bug when GDK window grab is enabled (reported at link). Also, we discovered that signals must be disconnected manually, so have done that as well in places where  required.

Message: Removed periods after "cm" abbreviation in crop tool aspect ratio popup box. This change resolves ticket #941.
Message Abstract: Removed periods after "cm" abbreviation in crop tool aspect ratio popup box. This change resolves ticket #941.

Message: 711: No full fixes for this, as it's been decided this is a Gtk issue.  However, did remove the scrollbars
Description: flashing as the window is shrunk by the user, which helps.  Also, in the investigation found some  unused/unnecessary code paths.  Also fine-tuned the readahead caching, which was not quite right.  Finally,  removing the flashing scrollbars revealed problems in fullscreen mode, and fixed that as well.
Message Abstract: 711: No full fixes for this, as it's been decided this is a Gtk issue.  However, did remove the scrollbars
Description Abstract: flashing as the window is shrunk by the user, which helps.  Also, in the investigation found some  unused/unnecessary code paths.  Also fine-tuned the readahead caching, which was not quite right.  Finally,  removing the flashing scrollbars revealed problems in fullscreen mode, and fixed that as well.

Message: Check the number of CPUs on Windows systems.
Message Abstract: Check the number of CPUs on Windows systems.

Message: Enabled building on a Mac via GTK-OSX.
Message Abstract: Enabled building on a Mac via GTK-OSX.

Message: 874: Increased event lull duration (event gap threshold) to 4 hours.
Message Abstract: 874: Increased event lull duration (event gap threshold) to 4 hours.

Message: 743: Now displaying a cancellable modal progress bar while rotating, reverting, or deleting a large number of
Description: photos at once.
Message Abstract: 743: Now displaying a cancellable modal progress bar while rotating, reverting, or deleting a large number of
Description Abstract: photos at once.

Description: On Windows, allow files to be imported by dragging them into the Shotwell window.   On Windows, added a linker flag which prevents a console window from appearing each time we run Shotwell.
Message Abstract: On Windows, allow files to be imported by dragging them into the
Description Abstract: Shotwell window. On Windows, added a linker flag which prevents a console window from appearing each time we run Shotwell.

Message: 899: Fixed crash on import due to faulty EXIF data.  Also fixed a bug due to recent readahead commit.
Message Abstract: 899: Fixed crash on import due to faulty EXIF data.  Also fixed a bug due to recent readahead commit.

Message: This prevents readahead in the direct edit case, which only slows it down (due to importing on the fly).  Will
Description: need to be revisited at a future point.
Message Abstract: This prevents readahead in the direct edit case, which only slows it down (due to importing on the fly).  Will
Description Abstract: need to be revisited at a future point.

Message: 741: Now performing readaheads in full-window and fullscreen view with a cache filled by background threads.
Description: Also fixed some issues exposed by these readaheads in direct edit mode and fullscreen mode.
Message Abstract: 741: Now performing readaheads in full-window and fullscreen view with a cache filled by background threads.
Description Abstract: Also fixed some issues exposed by these readaheads in direct edit mode and fullscreen mode.

Message: Added PNG icons for Windows port.
Message Abstract: Added PNG icons for Windows port.

Message: Various changes to allow Shotwell to build on Windows.
Description: (The new .png files will arrive in a separate commit since I have them on a different machine.)
Message Abstract: Various changes to allow Shotwell to build on Windows.
Description Abstract: (The new .png files will arrive in a separate commit since I have them on a different machine.)

Message: generalized EventProxyPage code to StubPage, which is used to create stubs for Event pages and EventDirectory pages.
Message Abstract: generalized EventProxyPage code to StubPage, which is used to create stubs for Event pages and EventDirectory pages.

Message: Upped to version 0.3.1 in preparation for 0.4.0 development.
Message Abstract: Upped to version 0.3.1 in preparation for 0.4.0 development.

Message: Branching to complete 0.3.0 tickets.  Trunk now code repository for 0.4.0.
Message Abstract: Branching to complete 0.3.0 tickets.  Trunk now code repository for 0.4.0.

Message: allows for sidebar navigation with keyboard
Message Abstract: allows for sidebar navigation with keyboard

Message: 893 exposed a bug in the import code where a file that was not copied into the library directory (typically
Description: ~/Pictures) because it was located inside the user photos directory was deleted if the import failed.  Shotwell  was deleting the file if it was supposed to be copied but wasn't.  Now, it only deletes if file was actually  copied.
Message Abstract: 893 exposed a bug in the import code where a file that was not copied into the library directory (typically
Description Abstract: ~/Pictures) because it was located inside the user photos directory was deleted if the import failed.  Shotwell  was deleting the file if it was supposed to be copied but wasn't.  Now, it only deletes if file was actually  copied.

Message: 534: User now asked at end of import if they want to delete the photos on the camera.
Message Abstract: 534: User now asked at end of import if they want to delete the photos on the camera.

Message: Resolves bug #891 ("Image does not grow/shrink with window when red-eye is activated, and may crash").
Message Abstract: Resolves bug #891 ("Image does not grow/shrink with window when red-eye is activated, and may crash").

Message: I failed to add a vapi patch and binary icon file in the previous commit; this commit adds these overlooked files.
Message Abstract: I failed to add a vapi patch and binary icon file in the previous commit; this commit adds these overlooked files.

Message: Completes implementation of feature #199 (Crop aspect ratios).
Message Abstract: Completes implementation of feature #199 (Crop aspect ratios).

Message: fixes for tickets 622 (tool placement in fullscreen), 835 (pixelated fullscreen image), 878 (titles persist between event pages), 666 (basic info pane padded), and 875 autoenhance shortcut)
Message Abstract: fixes for tickets 622 (tool placement in fullscreen), 835 (pixelated fullscreen image), 878 (titles persist between event pages), 666 (basic info pane padded), and 875 autoenhance shortcut)

Message: 535: Duplicates now detected on import and reported in summary to user.  This patch will check camera photos
Description: for duplicates via their EXIF/thumbnail hashes as well drag-and-drop files, either by EXIF/thumbnail (if  available) or by a full-file hash.
Message Abstract: 535: Duplicates now detected on import and reported in summary to user.  This patch will check camera photos
Description Abstract: for duplicates via their EXIF/thumbnail hashes as well drag-and-drop files, either by EXIF/thumbnail (if  available) or by a full-file hash.

Message: With libgphoto 2.4.6, EXIF data is garbage from the camera, so cannot accurately count how many preview bytes
Description: have to be downloaded when updating the progress bar.  Now merely reflecting the number of loaded photos  in the progress bar.
Message Abstract: With libgphoto 2.4.6, EXIF data is garbage from the camera, so cannot accurately count how many preview bytes
Description Abstract: have to be downloaded when updating the progress bar.  Now merely reflecting the number of loaded photos  in the progress bar.

Message: 888: This is due to the code rework for #887 and a bug in libgphoto2 2.4.6 where garbage is returned
Description: when querying for EXIF data on a camera photo.  This fixes the problem by querying for the EXIF and the  thumbnail separately.
Message Abstract: 888: This is due to the code rework for #887 and a bug in libgphoto2 2.4.6 where garbage is returned
Description Abstract: when querying for EXIF data on a camera photo.  This fixes the problem by querying for the EXIF and the  thumbnail separately.

Message: implements shift+arrow selection (393), the sidebar selection fix (877), and changes the unmount diaglog (883)
Message Abstract: implements shift+arrow selection (393), the sidebar selection fix (877), and changes the unmount diaglog (883)

Message: 536: Toggle button on import page allows user to hide photos that have already been imported.
Message Abstract: 536: Toggle button on import page allows user to hide photos that have already been imported.

Message: changed all instances of name to title, titles default to off
Message Abstract: changed all instances of name to title, titles default to off

Message: shift+home and shift+end now work properly.
Message Abstract: shift+home and shift+end now work properly.

Message: Fixes ampersand in event tooltip bug and corrects shift+click selection to be linear.
Message Abstract: Fixes ampersand in event tooltip bug and corrects shift+click selection to be linear.

Message: 866: Updated to work with libgee 0.5.0.  Deprecated calls now replaced with new methods.
Message Abstract: 866: Updated to work with libgee 0.5.0.  Deprecated calls now replaced with new methods.

Message: 865: Direct editing fixed.  Was not entirely integrated into the new architecture.
Message Abstract: 865: Direct editing fixed.  Was not entirely integrated into the new architecture.

Message: Added David Jeske to THANKS file.
Message Abstract: Added David Jeske to THANKS file.

Message: 612: (Jeske) Escape cancels current tool, then returns to collection page.  Removed "Return to Photos" from
Description: View menu.
Message Abstract: 612: (Jeske) Escape cancels current tool, then returns to collection page.  Removed "Return to Photos" from
Description Abstract: View menu.

Message: 658: (Jeske) F11 and Esc now exit fullscreen mode.
Message Abstract: 658: (Jeske) F11 and Esc now exit fullscreen mode.

Message: These changes make it so Shotwell starts with only the most recent event branch open, opens the tree containing an event when the event is selected, scrolls appropriately to a newly selected event in the sidebar, and maintains the expanded/collapsed state of the sidebar tree when resorting events.
Message Abstract: These changes make it so Shotwell starts with only the most recent event branch open, opens the tree containing an event when the event is selected, scrolls appropriately to a newly selected event in the sidebar, and maintains the expanded/collapsed state of the sidebar tree when resorting events.

Message: 859: Reflow was not occuring after import.  This fell out of some of the recent optimizations (but is fixed
Description: thanks to recent erchitecture change!)
Message Abstract: 859: Reflow was not occuring after import.  This fell out of some of the recent optimizations (but is fixed
Description Abstract: thanks to recent erchitecture change!)

Message: Fixed an issue where a reflow() wasn't being called when the new EventPage was realized on the screen.  This bug
Description: popped up in Allison's work on heirarchical events.
Message Abstract: Fixed an issue where a reflow() wasn't being called when the new EventPage was realized on the screen.  This bug
Description Abstract: popped up in Allison's work on heirarchical events.

Message: 842: Fixed.  #742: Fixed.  #710: Fixed.  Empty space shown on quick drag if thumbnail not in cache.  Good
Description: enough for now.  #709: Usable but could be better.  Good enough for now.
Message Abstract: 842: Fixed.  #742: Fixed.  #710: Fixed.  Empty space shown on quick drag if thumbnail not in cache.  Good
Description Abstract: enough for now.  #709: Usable but could be better.  Good enough for now.

Message: Added date hierarchy to event directory.
Message Abstract: Added date hierarchy to event directory.

Message: More work on improving UI responsiveness.  In particular, CheckerboardLayout now maintains a spatial
Description: (two-dimensional) data structure to allow for quicker traversal of its laid-out items.  This speeds up finding  items at pixel coordinates and intersections of area and items (which in turn is a boost in expose_event() and  update_visible_page()).
Message Abstract: More work on improving UI responsiveness.  In particular, CheckerboardLayout now maintains a spatial
Description Abstract: (two-dimensional) data structure to allow for quicker traversal of its laid-out items.  This speeds up finding  items at pixel coordinates and intersections of area and items (which in turn is a boost in expose_event() and  update_visible_page()).

Message: 710: Now using threads to load thumbnails in the background.  More work to be done to close ticket, but with
Description: blocking I/O now in the background, the UI controls are much more responsive.
Message Abstract: 710: Now using threads to load thumbnails in the background.  More work to be done to close ticket, but with
Description Abstract: blocking I/O now in the background, the UI controls are much more responsive.

Message: Improves auto-enhance performance by about 25%, closes #674.
Message Abstract: Improves auto-enhance performance by about 25%, closes #674.

Message: 710: Some work done to improve performance of scrollbar (with large libraries).  Specifically, this introduces
Description: the difference for a ThumbnailView to have a view_altered (which requires a repaint) and a geometry_altered  (which requires a reflow in the layout).
Message Abstract: 710: Some work done to improve performance of scrollbar (with large libraries).  Specifically, this introduces
Description Abstract: the difference for a ThumbnailView to have a view_altered (which requires a repaint) and a geometry_altered  (which requires a reflow in the layout).

Message: Fixes problems caused by missing photo files in slideshow.  Regresses on manual advance so that no low res image put up immediately, but that should be fixed with readahead.
Message Abstract: Fixes problems caused by missing photo files in slideshow.  Regresses on manual advance so that no low res image put up immediately, but that should be fixed with readahead.

Message: 824: Fixes for 0.7.7, binding updates and compiler/syntax changes.
Message Abstract: 824: Fixes for 0.7.7, binding updates and compiler/syntax changes.

Message: 809: Final step of model/view refactoring.  Data objects and their collections are now maintained in the
Description: classes in DataObject.vala and DataCollection.vala.  All other objects throughout the system can now access  photos and events in a unified way, and keep their own state synchronized consistently.
Message Abstract: 809: Final step of model/view refactoring.  Data objects and their collections are now maintained in the
Description Abstract: classes in DataObject.vala and DataCollection.vala.  All other objects throughout the system can now access  photos and events in a unified way, and keep their own state synchronized consistently.

Message: no longer crashes when photo file source is missing
Message Abstract: no longer crashes when photo file source is missing

Message: This revision implements full international support (enhancement #625) in the codebase and build system, including installation of translation files during make install. Enhancement #625 is now closed.
Message Abstract: This revision implements full international support (enhancement #625) in the codebase and build system, including installation of translation files during make install. Enhancement #625 is now closed.

Message: 809: Part two of the model/view refactoring.  Photo is now integrated into the new architecture, now breaking
Description: the other half of the Queryable system for Basic Properties.  After some consideration, didn't want to fold  these changes in with the next (which integrates Page with the new architecture) because that represents another  large change, and the two together will be unwieldy.  However, the next commit will restore Basic Properties.
Message Abstract: 809: Part two of the model/view refactoring.  Photo is now integrated into the new architecture, now breaking
Description Abstract: the other half of the Queryable system for Basic Properties.  After some consideration, didn't want to fold  these changes in with the next (which integrates Page with the new architecture) because that represents another  large change, and the two together will be unwieldy.  However, the next commit will restore Basic Properties.

Message: This revision includes fully internationalized program code. Internationalization support in the build process and packaging are not yet complete.
Message Abstract: This revision includes fully internationalized program code. Internationalization support in the build process and packaging are not yet complete.

Message: 809: This is part one of the model/view refactoring.  This adds the new DataObject and DataCollection classes
Description: which are the basis of all data objects in the system that need to be organized.  Event and EventSource were  refactored as part of this first pass.  Note that the properties sheet is broken when displaying events because  the refactoring is not complete.  The next commit (or perhaps the one after that) will fix this when Page and  its children are integrated with DataObject/DataCollection.
Message Abstract: 809: This is part one of the model/view refactoring.  This adds the new DataObject and DataCollection classes
Description Abstract: which are the basis of all data objects in the system that need to be organized.  Event and EventSource were  refactored as part of this first pass.  Note that the properties sheet is broken when displaying events because  the refactoring is not complete.  The next commit (or perhaps the one after that) will fix this when Page and  its children are integrated with DataObject/DataCollection.

Message: Fixes an assertion bug in direct edit mode.  Also, direct edit now takes advantage of some scaling optimizations
Description: recently made available.
Message Abstract: Fixes an assertion bug in direct edit mode.  Also, direct edit now takes advantage of some scaling optimizations
Description Abstract: recently made available.

Message: Implemented basic event rename, using a dialog.
Message Abstract: Implemented basic event rename, using a dialog.

Message: Regression: This speeds up the time it takes to display the Events Directory.
Message Abstract: Regression: This speeds up the time it takes to display the Events Directory.

Message: 257: Removed 64-pixel thumbnails.  Do not think at this time we need to have screen-sized thumbnails.  #621
Description: and #677: Applying color transformations is much speedier.  Pipeline only runs once, to generate thumbnails, and  thumbnails are now generated in the idle queue.
Message Abstract: 257: Removed 64-pixel thumbnails.  Do not think at this time we need to have screen-sized thumbnails.  #621
Description Abstract: and #677: Applying color transformations is much speedier.  Pipeline only runs once, to generate thumbnails, and  thumbnails are now generated in the idle queue.

Message: Added the Event class, which is akin to the Photo (now LibraryPhoto) class.  All event-related logic outside of
Description: database queries belongs here.
Message Abstract: Added the Event class, which is akin to the Photo (now LibraryPhoto) class.  All event-related logic outside of
Description Abstract: database queries belongs here.

Message: Fixes a couple of scaling bugs exposed with the recent changes to load-and-decode.  Also, tweaks and bug-fixes
Description: in the thumbnail caching.
Message Abstract: Fixes a couple of scaling bugs exposed with the recent changes to load-and-decode.  Also, tweaks and bug-fixes
Description Abstract: in the thumbnail caching.

Message: This is all work toward #677, attempting to avoid running the pipeline when doing edit operations.  Because the
Description: pipeline must be run for generating thumbnails, that run is not avoided with this check-in.  (This may be  addressed with background threads.)  This check-in avoids the pipeline when possible with current architecture,  and attempts to reuse an old pixbuf if the user cancels the edit tool.
Message Abstract: This is all work toward #677, attempting to avoid running the pipeline when doing edit operations.  Because the
Description Abstract: pipeline must be run for generating thumbnails, that run is not avoided with this check-in.  (This may be  addressed with background threads.)  This check-in avoids the pipeline when possible with current architecture,  and attempts to reuse an old pixbuf if the user cancels the edit tool.

Message: Fixed scaled load-and-decode to properly scale images which are re-oriented and/or have a crop.  Assertions in
Description: the code guarantee that the pixbuf should not be rescaled once it leaves the pipeline.
Message Abstract: Fixed scaled load-and-decode to properly scale images which are re-oriented and/or have a crop.  Assertions in
Description Abstract: the code guarantee that the pixbuf should not be rescaled once it leaves the pipeline.

Message: Auto-enhance sets the Shadows slider in this revision, completing implementation of enhancement #641.
Message Abstract: Auto-enhance sets the Shadows slider in this revision, completing implementation of enhancement #641.

Message: Now using a scaled load-and-decode in the pipeline.  Full-window images are no longer requested at screen size
Description: and then scaled to fit the window, but rather requested at window (actually, viewport) size.  Window resizing is  done with current pixbuf until the resize completes and the pipeline is re-run.
Message Abstract: Now using a scaled load-and-decode in the pipeline.  Full-window images are no longer requested at screen size
Description Abstract: and then scaled to fit the window, but rather requested at window (actually, viewport) size.  Window resizing is  done with current pixbuf until the resize completes and the pipeline is re-run.

Message: Adds a Shadows slider to the Adjustments palette, closing enhancement request #640.
Message Abstract: Adds a Shadows slider to the Adjustments palette, closing enhancement request #640.

Message: Optimizations to speed up the photo viewer, including using bilinear rather than hyper interpolation for images
Description: going to the screen.
Message Abstract: Optimizations to speed up the photo viewer, including using bilinear rather than hyper interpolation for images
Description Abstract: going to the screen.

Message: Resolves #738. Fixes a bug whereby the position of the exposure slider wasn't set properly when the Adjustments palette was opened. Increases image update performance when sliders are re-positioned in the Adjustments palette.
Message Abstract: Resolves #738. Fixes a bug whereby the position of the exposure slider wasn't set properly when the Adjustments palette was opened. Increases image update performance when sliders are re-positioned in the Adjustments palette.

Message: Added remove_transformation to Photo for set_adjustment().
Message Abstract: Added remove_transformation to Photo for set_adjustment().

Message: 737: Fixes enhancement being run twice when activated while another tool is open.
Message Abstract: 737: Fixes enhancement being run twice when activated while another tool is open.

Message: Fixed a minor bug introduced in the previous revision whereby the histogram graphic in the adjustment palette failed to update in response to movement of the exposure slider.
Message Abstract: Fixed a minor bug introduced in the previous revision whereby the histogram graphic in the adjustment palette failed to update in response to movement of the exposure slider.

Message: Color adjustment and enhancement are condensed into one operation in this revision (#678). This change was effected through a major refactoring of the color transformation subsystem. This refactoring provides other performance gains throughout the color transformation subsystem.
Message Abstract: Color adjustment and enhancement are condensed into one operation in this revision (#678). This change was effected through a major refactoring of the color transformation subsystem. This refactoring provides other performance gains throughout the color transformation subsystem.

Message: Bug: Need a TransformablePhoto.has_transformation() to deal with a null transformations map.
Message Abstract: Bug: Need a TransformablePhoto.has_transformation() to deal with a null transformations map.

Message: Added settings toolbar button in slideshow page.  Settings dialog allows user
Description: to modify the delay (in seconds) between slideshow frames.  The slideshow delay and display basic info menu option now persist between sessions.
Message Abstract: Added settings toolbar button in slideshow page.  Settings dialog allows user
Description Abstract: to modify the delay (in seconds) between slideshow frames.  The slideshow delay and display basic info menu option now persist between sessions.

Message: Refactoring of the drag-select code into CollectionLayout.  This is to push drawing code out of
Description: CheckerboardPage, which holds the selection list.  This is part of the refactoring for collections.
Message Abstract: Refactoring of the drag-select code into CollectionLayout.  This is to push drawing code out of
Description Abstract: CheckerboardPage, which holds the selection list.  This is part of the refactoring for collections.

Message: Widgetless thumbnail implementation.  This commit assists with #136.  Also added aggregate debug logging to
Description: ThumbnailCache, as its log messages interfered with performance testing.  CameraTable initializes after a delay  to shave even more time off the app startup time.
Message Abstract: Widgetless thumbnail implementation.  This commit assists with #136.  Also added aggregate debug logging to
Description Abstract: ThumbnailCache, as its log messages interfered with performance testing.  CameraTable initializes after a delay  to shave even more time off the app startup time.

Message: Nub icon not added to last commit.
Message Abstract: Nub icon not added to last commit.

Message: Adjustment palette now includes histogram slider controls (#615) that are automatically set by auto-enhance (#681).
Message Abstract: Adjustment palette now includes histogram slider controls (#615) that are automatically set by auto-enhance (#681).

Message: All PhotoTable rows are not stored in memory, to speed up startup.  Database verification is looser now, as all
Description: photos are not verified at initialization.
Message Abstract: All PhotoTable rows are not stored in memory, to speed up startup.  Database verification is looser now, as all
Description Abstract: photos are not verified at initialization.

Message: EventPages now loaded on-demand rather than created all at once.  A similar strategy can be used with albums.
Message Abstract: EventPages now loaded on-demand rather than created all at once.  A similar strategy can be used with albums.

Message: As part of #136: CollectionPage was iterating its parent's list to ensure the same photo was not added twice to
Description: its view.  Smart!  CollectionPage now maintains a HashMap of LibraryPhoto -> Thumbnail.
Message Abstract: As part of #136: CollectionPage was iterating its parent's list to ensure the same photo was not added twice to
Description Abstract: its view.  Smart!  CollectionPage now maintains a HashMap of LibraryPhoto -> Thumbnail.

Message: the basic properties display now updates with multiple selection.
Message Abstract: the basic properties display now updates with multiple selection.

Message: Detected a bug when testing iPhone 3.0 with Rob's: the unmount failed and the unmount progress bar remained
Description: visible and the camera remained marked as busy.  This fixes that problem.  Have not been able to reproduce the  unmount problem.
Message Abstract: Detected a bug when testing iPhone 3.0 with Rob's: the unmount failed and the unmount progress bar remained
Description Abstract: visible and the camera remained marked as busy.  This fixes that problem.  Have not been able to reproduce the  unmount problem.

Message: 670: When Shotwell first starts, it runs a verify_database() function.  This now looks for events with no
Description: end_time set (due to #665) and sets it to the exposure_time of the newest photo in the event.
Message Abstract: 670: When Shotwell first starts, it runs a verify_database() function.  This now looks for events with no
Description Abstract: end_time set (due to #665) and sets it to the exposure_time of the newest photo in the event.

Message: Gah ... corner-case in last commit.  This solves it.
Message Abstract: Gah ... corner-case in last commit.  This solves it.

Message: 669: F11 now works as it should in the Events Directory page.  Also cleaned up SinglePhotoPage to be more
Description: efficient about only creating a new pixmap when it's absolutely required.
Message Abstract: 669: F11 now works as it should in the Events Directory page.  Also cleaned up SinglePhotoPage to be more
Description Abstract: efficient about only creating a new pixmap when it's absolutely required.

Message: 533: Holding down the arrow key doesn't hang Shotwell any longer.  #63: Quick compare holding down the Shift
Description: key of a modified photo (works both in library and direct-edit mode).  #537: Slideshow now begins with selected  photo.  #665: Last event now marked with its end time.  #668: Toolbar now remains in-place in fullscreen mode  when using compiz.
Message Abstract: 533: Holding down the arrow key doesn't hang Shotwell any longer.  #63: Quick compare holding down the Shift
Description Abstract: key of a modified photo (works both in library and direct-edit mode).  #537: Slideshow now begins with selected  photo.  #665: Last event now marked with its end time.  #668: Toolbar now remains in-place in fullscreen mode  when using compiz.

Message: Fixed graying out Revert menu item in context menu.
Message Abstract: Fixed graying out Revert menu item in context menu.

Message: Fixes various problems in direct-edit identified by Adam, including Save/Save As behavior and dialog titles,
Description: displaying a dirty asterisk and path in the title bar (a la gedit), and handling cases where a file is  unreadable or undecodable.
Message Abstract: Fixes various problems in direct-edit identified by Adam, including Save/Save As behavior and dialog titles,
Description Abstract: displaying a dirty asterisk and path in the title bar (a la gedit), and handling cases where a file is  unreadable or undecodable.

Message: added display basic photo info feature for single selection
Message Abstract: added display basic photo info feature for single selection

Message: Regression in the refactoring for direct-edit mode; thumbnails were being re-oriented twice when the user
Description: rotated an image.  (Caught by Allison.)
Message Abstract: Regression in the refactoring for direct-edit mode; thumbnails were being re-oriented twice when the user
Description Abstract: rotated an image.  (Caught by Allison.)

Message: 652: Shotwell will now register itself as a JPEG viewer when installed.  Fixed About box.
Message Abstract: 652: Shotwell will now register itself as a JPEG viewer when installed.  Fixed About box.

Message: Edit/Undo -> Photo/Revert to Original.  A better solution in the future is for EditingHostPage to have its own
Description: PhotoMenu and PhotoContextMenu that is shared by the subclasses.
Message Abstract: Edit/Undo -> Photo/Revert to Original.  A better solution in the future is for EditingHostPage to have its own
Description Abstract: PhotoMenu and PhotoContextMenu that is shared by the subclasses.

Message: 647: Context menu added to direct editing page.  Queries before losing changes to photo.  Fixed thumbing
Description: through directory.
Message Abstract: 647: Context menu added to direct editing page.  Queries before losing changes to photo.  Fixed thumbing
Description Abstract: through directory.

Message: Added Save and Save As ... to direct editing window.  Moved more functionality from LibraryPhoto into
Description: TransformablePhoto.  Thumbing through directory now operational.
Message Abstract: Added Save and Save As ... to direct editing window.  Moved more functionality from LibraryPhoto into
Description Abstract: TransformablePhoto.  Thumbing through directory now operational.

Message: implements one-touch, toggle-able auto-enhance functionality; resolves ticket #62
Message Abstract: implements one-touch, toggle-able auto-enhance functionality; resolves ticket #62

Message: Fixed mechanics of replacing photo object displayed in full-screen view.
Message Abstract: Fixed mechanics of replacing photo object displayed in full-screen view.

Message: Broke PhotoPage into EditingHostPage and LibraryPhotoPage, in preparation for direct editing.  Also introduced
Description: PhotoCollection, a grouping interface for EditingHostPage to generically move through a group of photos.
Message Abstract: Broke PhotoPage into EditingHostPage and LibraryPhotoPage, in preparation for direct editing.  Also introduced
Description Abstract: PhotoCollection, a grouping interface for EditingHostPage to generically move through a group of photos.

Message: Moved PhotoTransformer into TransformablePhoto, which is now properly in the inheritance tree.  Also prepped
Description: PhotoPage for using TransformablePhoto rather than Photo (which is now LibraryPhoto), so it can be reused for  direct edit mode.
